Reviews.Title: “Continues to excel”
Reviews.Author: Maxsar911
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Peninsula maybe once a month for the last six months. There have been a couple glitches from time to time. That is to be expected if you travel a lot. At the Peninsula they take active steps to fix those glitches, and do so in a very positive way. The rooms are very nice. I would recommend one of the suites. The bar downstairs has a great atmosphere. I made a mistake of ordering a double of a fancy bourbon and drinking the whole thing. The location is right in the middle of things. That helps on those cold windy days when you want to go somewhere, but don't want to spend a lot of time outside. The fitness center has the best overall range of equipment that I remember for a dedicated exercise facility that is not part of a larger independent fitness center that just so happens to be attached to a hotel. I have stayed at most of the high end hotels in Chicago. The Peninsula is the best in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a beleiver!”
Reviews.Author: traveller4444
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Chicago this past weekend for a little business and a little pleasure. EVERYTHING was booked! All along the Mag Mile....Omni, Allerton, etc. etc..... I'd stayed on the Peninsula years ago but was too green to know a good hotel from a great hotel. But I left today...TOTALLY satisfied, and I am one PICKY SOB. :) I walked in Saturday to the registration desk and was greeted by Cecilia. I told her I'm in town for the night, don't have a room booked anywhere, and I don't want to pay a LOT of money. Well, she fixed me up with a room, and what was simply the best rate available...no special deals even with my charm and good looks, ha, ha. So....$395, and away I went to a slightly upgraded room. It was GREAT. The lighting, the colors, the cleanliness, the unmistakable attention to detail in every inch of the room was like being wrapped in a luxurious warm blanket. It just felt to GOOD! Super comfortable bed, a bathroom fit for a king, nice view, wonderful electronics (A/V, lighting, music, etc.) Five star...all the way. But here is what is different. I'm indeed used to nice hotels all over the world. But HERE, HERE, I found true customer service in EACH and EVERY employee! The Valet gentleman, the porters, Cecilia at registration, the MAID SERVICE was amazing!!! On this one point, let me elaborate. Each time I left my room (seemingly) I'd return to find my iPad cord wrapped up neatly, my toiletries, arranged label out, towels refreshed, slippers by the bed, plasma screen extended, ice in the bucket, bottle of water by the bed, etc, etc.... WONDERFUL! Our lovely maid from Sierra Leon in Western Africa was a gentle, proper, elegant woman who could NOT have done a better job. It's as though I had a dream about GREAT SERVICE, and thanks to my poor planning by not having a room reserved and serendipitously ending up at the Peninsula, it all came true. It was a pleasant surprise at EACH turn. They don't nickel and dime you either. Free WiFi, free coffee, shoe shines, tea, newspaper, and such. I know it's petty to mention that but so often at a hotel, you pay through the nose and then get hit for WiFi. I hate that. And I've NEVER had a free shoe shine. I didn't accept it, but it was all offered. Made me feel like royalty. I'm not a rich guy, and really shouldn't spend $395 plus parking and such on a night in a room, but let me say...it WAS worth it. It makes me want to work HARDER in life so I can afford such luxury again and again. Plus they're in my FAVORITE cities! Bangkok, Beijing, Paris, LA, NYC, Manila. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful in every way. Expensive? A little . Worth it, yep!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: areviewer
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The second time I have stayed here - it has to be the best hotel in Chicago. The rooms are really comfortable and the bathrooms fantastic. The bar is very cool and the staff are really helpful The spa is wonderful with an amazing gym and beautiful 25m pool The location is perfect. Just around the corner is the Ralph Lauren restaurant which is a must do - certainly my favourite in the CIty. I would definitely recommedn and always stay here if available

Reviews.Title: “Just ok but I would never give 5 stars...”
Reviews.Author: Violet A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Peninsula for 3 nights in February. I always stay at 5 star hotels, mostly Trump or Park Hyatt. When I found out I was supposed to go to Chicago, I called Amex and the Peninsula was recommended to me as one of the most popular hotels chosen by Amex holders. The hotel was fine but.. I received a $100 spa credit. Great gift if you can use it. I was not able to. There were only 4 available spa appointments during my 3 day stay, neither of them was what I was interested in. I was told they were booked because of the Valentine's Day.. When I asked to exchange my benefit to food and drink credit, the answer was 'no'. I had to call Amex and they spoke to a hotel manager about it. The room was nice, clean and comfortable but small - if you go to the Trump Hotel, you are immediately upgraded to a suit. Their swimming pool is much smaller than the one at Trump. Hard to find a concierge - I tried 3 times, unsuccessfully. Finally, when I found him (with a little help from a receptionist), I was told they had no business facility in their hotel ! I personally had called the Peninsula before I made a reservation and I was assured the business room would be available. The concierge recommended "a nice bar" in the area... I spent extra hours looking for a place where I could meet my clients. Overall, the Peninsula did not meet my expectations and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: mylolisbon
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the end of February. The hotel is all you expect from a Peninsula and both the breakfast area and room are fantastically welcoming and comfortable, makes you feel right at home....will definitely go back on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SBtraveler1
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula exceeded my expectations. The service throughout was excellent. The rooms were extremely quiet with very comfortable beds. They have one of the best equipped excercise rooms of any hotel (in addition to the beautiful city and lake views). I liked being able to control all the electronics in the rooms from a panel on the nightstand. The location is superb. I will defintely be returning here when back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiluver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favorites. The service is fantastic from the front desk to the bellman - everything is top-notch. My room overlooked Michigan Avenue and the Water Works Dept. Lovely beyond belief at night... When I left, I was already yearning to go back... Maybe one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: cuffy.fla
Reviews.Content: The afternoon tea service is divine. On the pricey side, but you will get plenty of food (like having a full meal) and the atmosphere is so relaxing. You sit in a big, bright room with lots of flowers and live musicians. It is a great break from shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Larry W
Reviews.Content: Peninsula Hotels are always good but the one in Chicago is especially nice with a great location near Michigan street. The rooms are very large and nicely appointed, with huge beds and views from higher floors. A nice view from the bathroom as well a larghe window on the top of the bathtub. Nice breakfast, exellent service.

Reviews.Title: “POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soma0506
Reviews.Content: Spent one night this past weekend at the Peninsula and couldn't wait to leave by check out time. This past weekend my GF and I decided to spend 1 night in Chicago to celebrate my birthday. I am an AMEX Platinum card member and called their travel service to book a room. I narrowed the choice between Trump Chicago and Peninsula, decided to go with Peninsula to take advantage of the $100 Spa Credit they offered to Platinum members. Arrived late friday night and left saturday afternoon. Positive: The room was a nice size with a great view of Magnificent Mile. Negative: It is the first and last time I will visit this hotel. The customer service was poor. When I voiced my concern to the night manager that his security staff was being aggressive, disrespectful and inappropriate. He dismissed and antagonized me. The staff was inattentive. I had to call room service multiple times to have my ordered completed. My GF cancelled her Spa massage because the staff completely ignored when she arrived there. This place needs an overhaul and they need to treat all their guests with the respect they deserve. I recently stayed at the Trump Chicago. Hands down in my opinion Trump is a better hotel and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Chip B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Peninsula this past weekend on a college visit for our son in Chicago. Great staff, accomodations, and location. Very attentive, almost too attentive when we arrived, as they kept dropping off "welcome gifts." The one quibble we may have is that the drapes did not quite close all the way, making the room very bright, very early in the morning. The Spa is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great, large, quiet rooms...”
Reviews.Author: TOWestonCT
Reviews.Content: Peninsula Hotels are always good but the one in Chicago is especially nice with a great location near Rush Street restaurants and a block over from the Magnificent Mile of high end stores and sights. The rooms are very large and nicely appointed, with huge beds and views from higher floors. I like quiet and the rooms are quiet indeed. I lost a button on my jacket and called for repair and it was back and pressed in my room in an hour. The restaurant in the lobby is very nice with an afternoon tea and a good luncheon. I would stay no where else in the windy city.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay”
Reviews.Author: Jinx223
Reviews.Content: Will always go back it was the best service,location and really clean. Just amazing the inside of the hotel and the suites were huge i will always reccomend it for any one who likes luxury and treated the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: njhlab
Reviews.Content: A brief, one-night stay for a business meeting but I was very impressed. I am a smoker, so I long ago resigned myself to tired-looking hotel rooms but this was immaculate. Best of all, from my perspective, was the bathroom. A separate shower and a full-sized bath (so rare in US hotel rooms), with the luxury of watching TV whilst lying in the bath. One small complaint: I only used the room service menu while I was there. Breakfast was excellent, but I do object to paying close to $15 for a pot of tea. No choice, as there isn't tea or coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhhh....Hear that service on the Peninsula?”
Reviews.Author: BillyTeddy
Reviews.Content: Surrounded by three sides of water you would expect to hear and see just about everything on a Peninsula. At the Peninsula in Chicago you get the spectacular views (rooms, "Bar", the restaurant and MI avenue views are grand) but you have no clue how it all comes together. It just does and it does in world class fashion. The service and staff are spectacular in their silent ways. My spouse had a 90 minute massage and rated it as one of the better experiences. I on the other hand took advantage of the well outfitted gym (just imagine running over the top of the water tower....that is your view) and finishing it off with a steam and/or hot tub in the pool area. The lap pool only is astonishing in its view and the staff is very very attentive on EVERY simple detail. Impressive! I am not sure if people "with money" read TA but for those of us who want to maximize the $ you won't go wrong at the Peninsula. From the Friday/Saturday night chocolate bar and live jazz to the fresh, and I mean fresh pastries the Penninsula is worth the splurge. Look for the packages that include breakfast ($21) and parking ($54/night) and it becomes a bit more attractive. Not inexpensive but most TREATS cost a bit more. We hand a grand deluxe king with a decent view of the water tower. But you never really want to leave the comfy bed or get out of the wonderful marble shower! Of course this slice of land is set in the ideal location and you really won't want or need a car. Save for a while and spend it on this little slice of heaven called the Penninsula. You will love the views and be in awe of the service. Wherever and however it happens.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing at every turn”
Reviews.Author: dhyland
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Location is perfect and the hotel leaves no stone un-turned. Our 4 night stay was flawless. Service was great. Staff was wonderful. 5 star all the way

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Khouree
Reviews.Content: We loved every second of our New Year's Eve getaway from the moment we arrived until we had to fly home. Service was impeccable and the suite was everything we could've asked for and then some. Enjoyed a massage to start off the new year right and I loved the relaxation room in the spa - the beds are so comfortable that I almost fell asleep. The staff went out of their way and accommodated our friends with a toddler and provided a crib complete with stuffed animal to make the little one happy! The hotel was kind enough to send us chocolates and fruit as a small holiday gift which was a nice touch and we did enjoy them along with some champagne. I miss the plush robes, the mood lighting and the tub in the executive suite...I would most definitely stay again when I return to Chicago, in fact I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Peninsula tops Ritz in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: JohnS46
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, great rooms, good/great food choices and perfect location are all contained at Peninsula. Group dinner for 30 was as well done as any I have attended. Service levels were unquestionable at the top. Rooms were well designed and with all the necessary features. Mini bar was well stocked with a broad selection of items. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here about 20 times”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: And The Peninsula never ceases to amaze me. It is one of the very few places where you can stay and be assured that your entire experience will be PERFECT. Frankly, when paying the rates at a 5 star hotel like this, one should have perfection. You will. I have stayed at many of the other 5 star hotels in Chicago, and none can compare to the Pen.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service service!”
Reviews.Author: ngerwig
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter and some friends here for her birthday. The staff was incredible from the moment we checked in making sure that she felt special for her birthday weekend. This hotel knows what it means to "go the extra mile" when it comes to service! The suite was fantastic! We will absolutely stay here when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable. First rate accommodations and service.”
Reviews.Author: Foo-D-GR
Reviews.Content: We found this the perfect place for a relaxing get-away. And, just outside the front door is an amazing array of things to do and see in the Windy City. For example,Tiffany's is on the ground floor. Where else can you find that? The hotel staff is expertly trained in customer service and are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are tasteful decorated and impossibly clean - everything gleams - and the whole hotel exudes a feeling of quiet and calm. You'll rarely, if ever, see the maids and there are no carts in the hallways. Everything happens as if by magic. Our room had fantastic amenities. Huge bathroom and guest bath in marble and glass, luxurious bed, fluffy bathrobes, tons of closet space, large living room, unique controls for mood lighting, electronics, privacy light, make-up room light, and even a door bell. The desk was outfitted with a printer and its own fax phone #. The concierge desk and pages were at our beckon call for everything our hearts desired. We didn't use them often, but it was great knowing they were there. There are simply too many thoughtful touches to list here. I highly recommend that you take a break and discover it for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: like2travel86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very, very nice! Our room was sized very comfortably with a king sized bed, desk w/2 chairs, sofa, and coffee table and overlooked Michigan Avenue. The bed was very comfortable, just like home. You pass through a small dressing area with bench as you enter a lovely marble bathroom. The sound system in both sleeping area and bathroom are a treat. It was also very clean, something I'm pretty picky about! Someone in an earlier review mentioned thin walls, I'm not sure what they were talking about. I couldn't hear anything outside our room. We didn't use the spa but will if we are fortunate to have the opportunity to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Years!”
Reviews.Author: DashAmpersand
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights over New Years. The rooms were spacious and immaculate. Best bathroom I have ever seen. The dining was superb. Service was beyond expectations. The New Years gala was exceptional with a dynamite 13 piece band. It costs a bundle to stay here but when you are looking for a top notch experience, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful classic 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wowtravels
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel back in June (yes a little late for my review) and truly enjoyed my stay. I stayed here on my last night while in Chicago, and I was so impressed with the Penn, from the minute I walked out of my cab. Highlights: â€¢ Gorgeous decor and ambiance all throughout the hotel, by far the nicest/grandest hotel in Chicago, for a 5 star hotel â€¢ Lots of natural light all threw out the hotel â€¢ Beautiful and very creative floral arrangements, thanks to Kehoe Designs â€¢ Very professional yet friendly service all threw out the hotel with excellent concierge service â€¢ Incredible rooftop pool/patio with lots of natural light â€¢ The Asian restaurant and the French bistro where both wonderful with great authentic ambiances and wonderful food/service â€¢ Lovely rooms, with gorgeous bathrooms and surprisingly great city views â€¢ Very comfy beds with soft linens and lots of pillows â€¢ Cool bedside controls (for lighting and drapes) â€¢ Very central location right on Mag Mile (great for shopping) Downfalls: (only a few minor gripes) â€¢ The biggest disappointment I had for this hotel, as much as I love it, for a five-star hotel, rooms surprisingly had horrible soundproofing windows (you could easily hear loud city noises and even hear people talking loudly, even thou I was up on the 7th floor) â€¢ Slightly dated decor in the rooms (lots of brass) â€¢ At times the service was stuffy and even to-over-the top I will for sure return back to this hotel, because I love the ambiance so much. It's well worth the $$$$ to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jvand00
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect...right off of Michigan Avenue. Excellent concierge service and room service. Spotless. High tech "command station" by every bed allows guests to control all the lights, curtains, and room temperature. The marble-filled bathrooms have separate shower stalls and tubs, vanities with plenty of room to sit. Add in the flat-screen TVs, and you have a classic hotel that feels very up-to-date.

Reviews.Title: “Always Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: This is our go-to hotel for Chicago and my favorite big-city hotel in the US. The service is exceptional, the food is top-notch, and the location cannot be beat. I've probably stayed 50 times in the last 5 years and they have never missed (when things go wrong (and they sometimes do) they are very quick to fix them and make it up to you).

Reviews.Title: “Fine city hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADSGWD
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard as far as luxury city hotels go. That being said, the service, amenities and property are first rate. There was just nothing that was outstanding or unique to this hotel. I will stay here again and would recommend it for those willing to spend the money. We didn't use the spa but plan on it during a future trip. The hotel has a wonderful, clean gym with a lovely view. Also, we very much enjoyed the cozy, quiet bar - very refined atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A treat in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Cheyenne2_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and decided on a whim to take a min-vacation for a few days to Chicago. Bought a package deal and stayed at the Peninsula. this is a hotel worthy a 4 or 5 star rating. Beautiful/elegant surroundings and public spaces, our room was spacious and beautifully appointed, and the staff service was helpful and efficient. you getthe feeling that everyone here is well trained and know how to deliver customer service. It's location is also excellent, steps from the Mile and from many attractions, we walked most of the time. It's not cheap, and the restaurants are a bit on the expensive side (a Light Breakfast was $65 for two) but worth it just for the surroundings. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in December. This hotel does what it does quite well. Impeccable service, spotless rooms, lovely amenities. The room was quite large with a nice selection of high end products. The bathroom had a deep run as well as separate marble shower with a glass door - a must in my view for a hotel of this calibre. Our choice of newspapers delivered in the AM, extremely comfortable bed with housekeeping service like stealth - you never knew they were around, yet everything always picked up and immaculate. Location in the heart of North Michigan. Ate breakfast both days at the restaurant - overall quite good. Sunday hosted an unbelievably well stocked buffet. Workout room clean and well equipped with cardio and weights- complimentary for guests. We expected alot here, and we were not disappointed. A great splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in the Heart of the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: AlanH1
Reviews.Content: Room as well laid out and very spacious (for Chicago Standards)! Service was excellent throughout our stay (we were doing some shopping downtown for the holidays). We spent one evening at the bar downstairs and I must say that it was cozy, warm and the bartenders/drinks were outstanding. Not the cheapest place to stay in Chicago but at least you are able to obtain a great experience in return. Cannot go wrong with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelChicago
Reviews.Content: This is the first time either my husband or I had stayed at The Peninsula. It is one of the nicer hotels in Chicago we have been wanting to visit. We took our 2 year old daughter, so opted for a suite. I looked at the floor plans prior to booking, and had decided that their least expensive Executive Suite would work best for our needs. Upon check-in, we were offered a drawing for some in-house prizes, and we drew a room upgrade to a Junior Suite. I was concerned about the lay out working as well for us. I tried to get the woman at registration to explain to me why the Junior Suite would be a better option for us, and all she kept saying was that it is a more expensive suite - as if it would be silly not to take it. We finally gave in and took the upgrade, and it was a lovely room overlooking Michigan Avenue, although I still think we maybe should have stuck with our originally reserved room. I just didn't feel the woman who checked us in was as helpful as she could have been at this level of property. We encountered other members of the front desk staff who were very helpful and friendly, and everyone was very kind to our little one. We had breakfast both mornings in The Lobby restaurant. The food was good, and the service was great the first day and just okay the second day. Valet was efficient, all things considered with that location, and very friendly. We used the pool several times throughout our 2 night stay, and the people who worked in the spa were always very kind to bring goggles and toys for my daughter. The pool area was very nice, with the air temperature kept warm and the water slightly cool for those wanting to swim laps. The entire property was spotless at all times. Housekeeping was very good, and we appreciated them remembering to make up the sleeper sofa for our daughter the second night. Overall, a very nice stay and a lovely hotel, even if it didn't "wow" us as much as we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Tops in Service”
Reviews.Author: MUFanMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row my husband and I spent a weekend at The Peninsula Hotel in December to enjoy the lights and do a little shopping and I just don't know that you can beat the service! The employees welcome you so warmly and constantly are thanking you for patronzing the hotel. They are quick to meet your every need. In my opinion the guest rooms are just wonderful, from the great big bathroom, to the decor to the comfortable beds. We always like to get a drink in the bar and order breakfast from room service which a real treat. They bring a table with a hot box up and you just indulge! Location is top notch. I just can't say enough about the way we are always treated at The Peninsula!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms, very good service, busy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: agpklp
Reviews.Content: Location just off Michigan can't be beat. Close to great restaurants and shopping. Rooms are as nice as anywhere (Ritz, Four Seasons etc.) although more high tech. Every light can be controlled by a master control for brightness, mood etc. There is a temperature reading by the door that tells outside temp - very useful in Chicago. Great sound system that plays throughout entire room and bath. Bed is tops. Bath and shower - as good as it gets. TV in bath. Service is very good all around. Maids fold any clothing left out, have shoes shinned, coil up lose cords from cell phone, computers etc. Lots of nice personal touches. No real negatives. Like many city hotels the lobby is up a floor and a little inconvenient. Very active hotel with parties, banquets etc... If you like slow and quite a boutique hotel might appeal to you more.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: AGoodCupofJoe
Reviews.Content: We stay there at least once a year. Again they prove in all ways large and small that they are the greatest hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best City/Business Hotel In America”
Reviews.Author: charlesa3rd
Reviews.Content: Hands down, this hotel delivers "perfect" stays more consistently than any other city hotel in a major market in the country. When your room door closes behind you, you feel completely secure and "in residence". Great spa, awesome gym with a commanding view. Flat screen TVs, iPod docs with advanced audio visual. Friendly staff eager to anticipate and serve your needs.Terrific bar, also a decent place to eat if you are dining alone.

Reviews.Title: “Tied for #1 in Chicago (in my book)!!”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough how much I like Peninsula Chicago - all the staff are great. The room was wonderful. Yes, the bathroom itself is another treat. You can listen to music or watch tv while you are enjoying a nice long bath in the tub. Complimentary coffee and tea every morning at the lobby or the health club are of excellent quality, as you expected. The breakfast the the "Lobby" always great - spacious seating with amazing sunslight coming through the window. Food at Shanghai Terrace was delicious and I did not need to go to Chinatown (unless you want Dim Sum or other special dishes). Hotel location was perfect for shopping, meeting, and sightseeing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Robj47
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at Peninsula for Holiday Lights Festival and the entire experience was superb. Friendly helpful staff, amazing rooms, an absolutely heavenly stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Colafina
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Peninsula was wonderful. The location was perfect and I was pleasantly surprised by the 60 degree November weather which was great for walking around the city! I wasn't able to take advantage of all of the amenities at the hotel since I was working, but the rooms were comfortable and spotless. The bathroom was amazing. Only complaint is that the service is too good; I do not like that the room attendant found my dirty laundry and folded it nor did I like finding my toothbrush in a different place. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: BillStickers_7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fantastic hotel. Huge room with couch, extra chairs, wood-and-glass table, thick carpet, desk with stapler, highlighter, rubber bands, sticki-notes. Bathroom with extra deep tub and tv; complete clean shower (that is, no mold on the grout â€“ a pet peeve of mine.) Great view of Michigan Ave., the water tower and John Hancock building. Locally owned pizza places, Walgreen pharmacy, fancy shopping (Nieman Marcus, Macyâ€™s) all within 1-2 blocks. Nice lobby bar â€“ lights not too bright, music not too loud, drinks not too overpriced, gas fireplace for extra atmosphere. Attentive, courteous staff. Cons: No thermostat in room (at least none I could find), so it was a little too cool in the morning, too stuffy at night. No direct access from room to street level â€“ need to take one elevator from room to lobby then another from lobby to ground level. A bit of street noise on 11th floor â€“ maybe itâ€™s quieter higher up. Except for a single siren, things quieted down for the most part at night. (I often need to wear ear plugs to sleep in hotels, but not this place.)

Reviews.Title: “five star”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: Simply one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. Classy, great service, fantastic room, and right in the heart of Chicago. If your budget allows for high-end accommodations, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: travelerdocmom
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Peninsula Chicago once or twice a year and are always impressed by the stellar service and luxurious rooms. I travel frequently for work and am dismayed by the poor service that seems to be routine at most other hotels. It is a rare event when I can check out of a hotel without having some constructive feedback for the management. But the Peninsula staff know how to treat their guests. Although downtown Chicago was crowded with tourists and traffic, once we arrived in the upstairs lobby, we felt like we were in another world. There was no line at the check in counter, and they made us feel welcome as returning guests and even greeted my daughter by name. When we have stayed there for birthdays, they always leave a lovely plate of fruit and treats for us. The rooms are supremely comfortable, and the tv in the bathtub is always a highlight for the kids. The pool is clean and large enough for laps and is rarely crowded. The gym is well equipped and the spa services are fabulous. We were in a rush to get to the airport on the morning of check-out and told our waiter at breakfast in the lobby restaurant that we needed to get out quickly. Our food arrived within a couple of minutes, perfectly prepared. The small touches, like free bottled water in the room, free internet access, free local calls, and New York Times delivered every morning, make a real difference. The rates are high, but unlike many other so-called luxury hotels, where guests are charged for lots of extras and service is spotty, the Peninsula Chicago is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful....expensive but worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: goombie
Reviews.Content: Excellent few days in Chicago...hotel is a haven to relax in post meetings. Staff are helpful and do not beg for tips which is great as you don't feel hassled. Rooms are quiet, bathrooms and bed lovely, nice cosmetics etc...all good!

Reviews.Title: “First Class al the way!”
Reviews.Author: andiamo123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Peninsula. We are annual guests as we attend a law conference each November. I can only say it is truly the most wodnerful hotel we have ever visited. The executive suite is perfect to allow enough space without feeling restricted. The views are magnificent!! I would especially like to mention the concierge desk, namely Robert and Gianna. We enjoyed fabulous meals and a wonderful stay due to their assistance in dining suggestions, securing reservations etc. Their attention to detail is beyond any I've experienced anywhere!! Also, Liz in the Spa is truly a gem and I would suggest stopping in for a faciol if you ahve the time. She is FABULOUS!! The entire staff at the Peninsula from reservations to heousekeeping and check out is superb. Scott at the front door....thanks again for your umbrella!! And to all of you who personally greet us each day, filling our ice bucket, providing special amenities we requested....it is all 100% class and top notch. I would (and HAVE) recommended the Peninsula to EVERYONE!! If you have the opportunity, by all means go and stay as long as you can!!! It is fabulous....I could go on all day......!!! The lobby restaurant, the Pierrot Gourmet (felt like Paris!!), the Bar, jazz combos in the evening, afternoon tea.....well, again, go and enjoy!! Kudos to the staff and management. A true gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected a wonderful stay, but wow...”
Reviews.Author: TJGREY
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights at this truly remarkable hotel. Of course it's beautiful and elegant and I love all of the simple electronic amenities, but beyond that, the service was magnificent. The location is excellent as well. Wish we could have stayed longer. There are many hotels, and hotel chains that pretend to be first-class, but the Peninsula Chicago truly is.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: likesunusallodging
Reviews.Content: Our recent "American Girl" package was absolutely wonderful. My granddaughter was amazed at the care and attention we received for herself and her doll. We also enjoyed afternoon tea and later the chocolate buffet, a must for a stay here. My granddaughter later pretended to be the clerk who checked us in, using all the wonderfully polite wording and attention we were given. Will stay there again when in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_DC
Reviews.Content: If I need to comment something then it would be to cold welcome at the front desk, but this personal and will not make me pick another hotel next time. I also found the temperature in the common areas way to low, but now i am realy looking to find something. Would defenetly recommend this hotel and go back, good chinese restaurant, good breakfast, great rooms with walk in shower etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JeanieTG
Reviews.Content: We were there at the end of September 2011 and I love this hotel! It is a great location on Michigan Avenue. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Our room was so nice. Lots of space, great view, lovely bathroom and amazing technology. The fax machine in the room is a huge amenity when you are there for business. The bed was very comfortable. The TV swings out into the room for watching from bed which is pretty cool. We needed an iron and called the front desk. Within minutes there was someone at the door with an ironing board, iron, and starch. He offered to set it up for me! They have complimentary shoe shining which is so nice. You just put your shoes in a bag and they return them freshly waxed and shined. Overall, I loved this hotel. It was a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best there is, not just Chicago, but North America.”
Reviews.Author: Papa070
Reviews.Content: Chicago is gorgeous and there are numerous great hotels. The best is the Peninsula. The location is perfect, right off Michigan and in the midst of everything. The entrance does not completely portray the beauty of the hotel, as you leave your luggage, and take the elevator to the lobby level. Then, it begins--a beautiful arcade/hallway, leading to the concierge and reception, with a continental restaurant serving three meals and afternoon tea and the best Sunday brunch. They also had a talented three piece jazz band on Saturday night. Down a flight is a top Chinese restaurant, and in the building is a french brasserie. The decorating is absolutely first rate, and then there are the rooms. We were fortunate to get their 2 for 1 deal, and also an upgrade to a suite, which included a complimentary mini cooper with driver. The bathrooms are large and perfect, there is a dressing room and closets and drawers, and the beds and furnishings are comfortable and lovely. My granddaughter began SAIC, which is the art school attached to the beautiful Art Museum down the street, and I also met with specialist doctors at Northwestern Medical down the street. Simply, a great weekend at a truly great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjrdomer
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for 1 night and did not take full advantage of the hotel's ammenities. All I have to say is that it is a beautiful property, with very well appointed and spacious rooms (especially for an urban hotel). The bathroom was very nice with a full tub and separate shower. The bed was comfortable with superior linens. We did go to the hotel bar for a drink and the service was impeccable. The host who sat us actually went out of his way to seat us first when he saw us waiting at the entrance and another couple barged in and went right up to him for a seat. He politely refused them and came over to seat us first as we were in line first. Now that is class!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: dcdowntown
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to this Peninsula twice in the past few weeks. The first time (Sept) we went to install my daughter in college and the second (Oct) for the school's "parents weekend." On the earlier trip the hotel went far beyond our desire to give our daughter a pleasant start to her transition to dorm living. We booked two adjoining rooms for ourselves and our two children. We flew into town early and decided to have our bags held at the front desk while we started out for that don't-want-to-carry-it-on-the-plane-but-gotta-have-it-for-your-dorm shopping excursion. The woman checking us in spent some time chatting with my wife, told us our rooms weren't ready yet and took our bags. While we were making our big-box store rounds, we were called by the front desk manager who offered an upgrade to a suite, at no increased cost. We said yes. On returning to the hotel we were shown to a very large suite with views of the lake. It was an extremely generous upgrade. The rest of the good reviews are consistent with my experience. The lobby, bar and public spaces are pleasant, the rooms well-appointed, the proximity to Michigan Avenue excellent. Small points to add. There is a weekend p.m. chocolate buffet in the lobby with live jazz that is very well done. Traffic on Superior, the street out front, can be jammed at times, so if you have a car or need one, allow for that if you are in a rush when traffic is snarled. There is a famous deep-dish pizza joint on the next corner, Giordano's, that everyone (adults and kids) likes; so much so, that there are more rules than East Germany if you want to get a pie anywhere near the dinner hour. They deliver promptly to the hotel, so you can choose to tackle the long waits in comfort. The exercise facilities (large with plenty of equipment) and pool, located in the spa on the 20th floor have great views.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Dom S
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting business trip with several meetings in Chicago I checked into the Peninsula for one night before heading on to Toronto. Immediately I realized that I did the right choice. The room on the 17th floor was spacious, elegant and calm. Everything I needed was there and everything was done with good taste. Although the hotel is celebrating its 10th anniversary, it was in top condition, updated and fresh. After a relaxing shower in a marvelous bathroom I run out to do some shopping on Michigan Street with its international top brand stores only a footstep away. It was just before the shops closed, but still in time to find a small gift for my wife. All in all a perfect experience in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Much has been said and its all true!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninasch1976
Reviews.Content: I can only say it is the best hotel in North America that i have stayed in. The Service is top, the Location can not be better, you just step out of the hotel and there is Tiffany, Ralph Lauren, VictoriasSecret and more in the same builing! WOW! The Pool is very convenient, the ESPA Spa a must go and all therapists there (especially the male) was perfect. Shanghai Terasse is their high class Chinese Restaurant, its devine. Breakfast was so convenient and nice in the Lobby, my goodness when can i go again. Last but not least: The rooms are huge, the beds amazingly cozy, i have found my paradise in Chicago. Do not hesitate, just go!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chicago if not all large US cities”
Reviews.Author: CVO719
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsula in October 2011. Everything is meticulous and detailed. The food is fabulous from the fresh squeezed juice to every other item that I tasted. It is perfectly located for shopping even if you are there on business. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - it's only drawback is that you do get what you pay for. Just the bathtub with the TV at the end is worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mav1244
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and found the staff to be extremely attentive for a such large hotel. The rooms were a very good size and comfortable although i did find it odd that I had to phone for room service to provide me with a kettle and coffee/tea so that I could make a drink first thing in the morning. It is definitely a business hotel and is conveniently right next to the main shopping street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with one glitch”
Reviews.Author: Maxsar911
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location. Have stayed there many times. Good food, service and rooms It has a nice exercise room that is listed as being 24 hours. I went downstairs at 5:00am after I couldn't get the elevator to go up to the 20th floor. The clerk at the desk said that the elevator was closed until 5:30 which would be the earliest I could exercise. I didn't have time so I moved on. I did complain on the comment sheet after double checking that the hotel says it has a 24 hour fitness center. A couple things happened. I got an email from a manager saying they had made a mistake and had gone back to make sure that their staff know to get security for guests if they want to exercise early. I sent back an appreciative thanks. He called me at work, but couldn't get me. I forgot about the whole thing, then I got another call from him about 5 days later. He just wanted to make sure he apologized personally. It was well done. Mistakes happen. How people and companies respond shows how good an organization is.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for the Second Time”
Reviews.Author: jillyp16
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Peninsula with our children. We have stayed at the Peninsula several times in the past. But this is the second time I have been disappointed with our stay there. The last time we stayed there (which I failed to review until now) was a disappointment for this reason: We had decided to stay at the hotel in order to try the Hastens mattress that they at one time advertised. We specifically requested a room with a Hastens bed, as we were considering purchasing one. When we arrived to check in, they did not seem to know about the request and said that particular room wasn't ready and so we waited for quite some time. Long story short--we called the front desk to tell them we didn't think it was a Hastens bed (they have a distinctive checked pattern) and were assured by the front desk, in a somewhat snotty way, that it in fact was. As we were getting ready to check out, housekeeping pulled the sheets off & I saw that it was a Sealy mattress. I just felt kind of ripped off. We decided to give it another try last weekend. This time we were disappointed due to the overall attitude of most of the hotel staff. The concierge desk (more than one) was unorganized and a bit snotty in booking dinner reservations, etc. I asked a female concierge for advice on a restaurant and she was uninterested in helping me. I should also add that it is quite difficult to call the concierge from outside of the hotel. Go ahead, try it. You will not find the number online and will have to be given another number to call, be transferred, etc. Not a big deal if everyone is nice and helpful when you finally get through. What, to me, separates a luxury hotel from a regular hotel is the degree of service and how that service makes you feel as a guest of the hotel. For example, at most Four Seasons properties, the staff makes you feel like a rock star. Cheesy, but true. Guests want to feel important. Here, the service was very inconsistent and I felt the attitude was almost like an East Coast snobby vibe (no offense intended). No major rudeness, just like we were inconveniencing them to ask for something. Room service was at times wonderfully polite and then mediocre, depending upon who answered. As for housekeeping, we left one morning at around 9:30am & put the "please make up room" light on. When we came home at 5:30pm to shower and change for dinner, the maid had just arrived and had not started cleaning yet. Just kind of an inconvenience. The one bright spot was the bell and valet staff. They were exceptionally courteous and helpful. In fairness, I should mention that the hotel is lovely. And it is quite welcoming of families with children. There was a very nice welcome treat (with gummy bears) that my kids really enjoyed. They were also thoughtful enough to provide small robes and slippers for the kids. While they do have a nice-sounding children's menu, some of the food we ordered was really subpar (ie-chicken fingers were pretty bad, as was the "children's tea"--my kids wouldn't eat it). Overall, my main issue is attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Check out the roof deck on 4th floor”
Reviews.Author: nodrama1
Reviews.Content: A truly high end hotel. I was at a conference and several functions were held on the rooftop overlooking Michigan avenue. When the weather is good the roof deck is fantastic. Beautiful rooms with easy to function alarm clock, lights and thermostat (don't under rate this - many times at other hotels I have had to call the operator to work things out). Location is excellent - right in the heart of Michigan Ave

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for Service”
Reviews.Author: Baddydaddy
Reviews.Content: Though pricey, this place delivers unsurpassed service. You definitely feel like you are getting something special.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie2846
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. You can easily understand why celebrities stay at this hotel. The level of service lived beyond its reputation. Everyone anticipated your needs and was very pleasant helping. From the mini-driver to the concierge to the wait staff bringing breakfast every morning, the service should be what every 5 star hotel aspires to. Clean, beautiful, comfortable. Best hotel experience I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: This was among my best hotel experiences ever. I've stayed hundreds of nights in places all around the world and the service at this hotel is exceptional. After I checked in, the attendant took me to my room and gave me a run down of all the accoutrements. Despite numerous guests, I waited for nothing. Immediate access to facilities, concierges, and services. The property itself is very comfortable. The bed in the room itself was initially great but settled through the feathers to a firmer style I generally don't like. The bathroom was awesome and the TV near the tub was cool. Very comfortable and a quick walk to many places in the heart of gorgeous Chicago. Right across the street from Giordano's if you like the famous stuft crust pizza! I had great weather that day and it was an awesome overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service”
Reviews.Author: 98chevysub
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula Hotel chain is known for exceptional customer service. I recently found this to be consistent while staying at the Chicago location. I have stayed at this location before, as well as Beverly Hills and New York City. My trip September 10, 2011 was just for one night, for a friend's baby shower which I flew in for. My room was upgraded as I am a repeat guest and I appreciate being recognized as such. The concierge, Robert, greeted me with a huge smile by name even after not seeing him for a few years! I ordered room service and found the food as expected- fresh, beautifully presented and delicious. I enjoyed the spa- I used the steam room and also luckily grabbed a toiletry kit as I had forgotten my tooth brush. I also enjoyed the Peninsula bar which is one of my favorite hotel bars, and the dining room for breakfast with a friend. The hotel location is perfect for shopping, sight seeing, city life, walking/strolling, and enjoying Michigan Avenue. My room was so comfortable and luxurious- a corner room on the 17th floor where I was mesmerized by views of the full moon rising out my windows. It was a lovely 24 hour splurge with comfort, service, and the pleasure of excellent attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “truly the best city hotel in the US”
Reviews.Author: SearchingUsa
Reviews.Content: We've been loyal Peninsula visitors for years and returned this year for another weekend retreat. It is truly the best of the best for its level of personal and dedicated service. In Chicago, the location is outstanding and the restaurants are of the highest quality anywhere. My wife is a passionate advocate of the Spa and the pool space - again the best in Chicago. We'll be back for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Arlington7175
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing more that I can add to all of the positive reviews written by others. We try to go to The Peninsula once a year, and I always look forward to staying at the hotel. Yes, as others have stated, it is expensive, and if you want over the top glam for the money this is not the right place for you. If you want very comfortable, under stated luxury, then The Peninsula fits the bill. Service is impeccable and the rooms are designed to anticipate your needs. I have not experienced a hotel room that is laid out as well as the rooms here. Also, we have never done the chocolate late night buffet, but I've heard many good things. We have had the Sunday brunch several times, and it is outstanding each time. Once again it is expensive, but it includes a wide range of options of extremely high quality. I'm looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence2300
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels, perhaps hundreds. None come close to the Peninsula in terms of getting it right. This hotel defines every standard. Sorry to say, I could not find a flaw. So, my review will simply define some of the extra touches that went into this definition. In no particular order: When you arrive, you face the concierge desk, not the reception. The concierge, rather than point my to the reception walked with me over to the reception, and struck up a fascinating conversation. The room with more logical electronics, well laid out, with easy to read instructions, even a TV remote that illuminated when you touched it. A welcome fruit layout (I was not VIP'd or anything like that). A breakfast, where upon ordering oatmeal, I made a comment to my colleague that the sugar was not real brown sugar. I did not ask the staff for n alternate; they came with it in any event. We were working in a suite on a business program, ordered coffee. It arrived, and about an hour later, they brought a second carafe, because the waiter thought we looked as if one was not going to be enough. (He was so right!) When I went to leave, I did not check out, as I was late. Yet, the doorman, somehow, knew my name...there was no way he could have been alerted to my depature! The bar has been set very high.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet pampering”
Reviews.Author: ck5
Reviews.Content: This is their anniversary year, so through December, you may find some special rates or add ons. The Peninsula staff is what makes the hotel so wonderful...never pushy, but always accommodating, they are quick to answer all requests. The pool, spa and gym are on the 20th floor with fabulous views. In warm weather, be sure to sit on the small outdoor terrace by the pool. The Lobby Restaurant serves nice food in a lovely setting as does Shanghai Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Elegance”
Reviews.Author: das317
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 6 nights. The service and mamagement was excellent. The rooms are comfortable and staff is well trained, friendly and eager to accomodate requests. The Hotel is centrally located to the main shopping district and near other attractions like the Water Tower. We did not like the dinner we had in the Lobby restaurant but breakfast was good and it was not a buffet! This Hotel is worth paying a extra for.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in America-redux”
Reviews.Author: hotelfan
Reviews.Content: I have had the good fortune to stay in this wonderful property 6 times. I have been so spoiled by each experience that I am always terrified that there is no way it can live up to my expectations. I just spent 5 nights there with my 20 year old son (before he returns to college) and I'm delighted to report that, as usual, The Pen exceeded all of my expectations. This hotel has it all. An unbelievable staff, a phenomenal location, 4 great restaurants, a terrific bar, and perhaps THE best fitness center/pool in the world. The cardio machines are beyond state of the art and the pool is gorgeous and inviting. Every time you interact w/a Peninsula staff member, you are greeted with someone who meets your gaze and wishes you a good morning/afternoon/evening. These folks are genuinely vested in your visit and consistently go beyond and above the call to insure that all of your needs/wants are met. The staff, from the doorman to housekeeping to room service are all professional, warm, unpretentious, and wonderful. The director of guest relations, LeeAnn Brown, has become a family member and friend. She is genuinely concerned about our well being and has-miraculously- found a source for "Chuckles" which are sadly, very difficult to find for all but Ms. Brown. I travel a lot. Nobody but Ms. Brown has sought out and procured "chuckles" for me. Thank you! On this visit, we had a wonderful experience in the Shanghai Terrace and another in the street level restaurant. I'm really picky but this place is beyond the call. From the size and weight of the towels to the TV/radio in the bathrooms to the free wi-fi and water that is set out for you each night, this is THE place you want to come home to. I cannot recommend any property, anywhere, with greater enthusiasm than I do the Chicago Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience in the U.S>”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at The Peninsula in Chicago. The hotel room was plush, quiet and with an elegant floor plan. The hotel has excellent restaurants, a cool bar and a great spa with a full-sized lap pool which we used every evening before dinner. The location is perfect for visiting Chicago and our room was always a tranquil sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city. On our last night we had excellent room service from the Shanghai Terrace; we felt very well taken care of (and had dinner in our pajamas)! The service at the hotel was top notch, especially housekeeping. They do and excellent turn-down service before bedtime. Staying at the Peninsula was the best hotel experience we have had in the United States.

Reviews.Title: “"You get what you pay for " and more!”
Reviews.Author: Ted1348
Reviews.Content: I wanted to treat my 20 year old daughter to a gala weekend in Chicago and could not have picked a better hotel than the Peninsula.I had stayed at the Peninsula once before. I was very impressed with this hotel, so I knew we would have a excellent hotel experience ahead of us. And we did as I will explain. We were lucky to be part of The Tenth Year Anniversary Celebration that the hotel had to offer. This basically was an offer for the first night room rate at full price and then the second night rate at $10 dollars!!! Yes I took the offer! I had called the hotel for an early check-in. When we arrived we were able to get into our beautiful Delux Suite 3 hours early!!! Upon entering our suite we had a welcome card and assorted fruit and nut tray. After going out for a few hours we returned to a complimentary bottle of fine wine and chocolates. We had room service twice a day. If you can afford a Delux Suite I would say go for it.We had two queen beds in the bedroom although you can have the choice of a one king bed in this type of suite.This suite also has a pull out bed in the living room if needed . The suite had an luxurious master bath and off the living foyer is a very nice half bath. My daughter said that she would actually love to live in this suite.We did have a small view of Lake Michigan. The gym on the 20th floor is well equipped with even better views of the city and servral views of Lake Michigan.We did not use the spa but I will on the next visit. We had afternoon tea in the main restaurant/lobby area both days.The tea selection is over the top as you might expect. We enjoyed the orchid oolong tea with a vanilla -coconut flavor. Our first night we had dinner in The Shanghi Terrace at 7:30 pm. There were quite a lot of children having dinner before this time. I opted for indoor seating which I felt to be more intimate and quite than outdoor seating. By 7:30 pm most of the children had had their dinner and there were no children seated indoors when we had our very fine 2 and half hour feast on a friday night.. I enjoyed the Crispy Duck as my entree. One nice feature about our suite is that several side windows could be cracked open a bit letting lake breezes fill the room if you wish.. I had asked my daughter before we left to leave the city if she could think of one flaw that the Peninsula possessed. She said after some thought " No". I totally agreed with her! Yes, you get what you pay for and more.The more is all the little things that a hotel of this quality does for you. A concierge that I only briefy talked to, and who was not our main concierge, new my name the next day! I used to be a loyal to The Mandarin Oriental Hotels.I thought they were the best. Now the Peninsula in Chicago is my number one city hotel, by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: 2Itravel4fun
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a very expensive hotel. No doubt if you are considering staying here, you already know this. For this reason, it seems a little unfair to compare it up against hotels that are charging much less for a nights stay. It never feels quite right to me to expect the same thing out of a Kia as one would out of a Masserati. So...in my review, I'm really only comparing it up against similar hotels who charge fairly handsome prices. First of all, it's an attractive hotel. Clean, comfortable, great location just around the corner from Neiman Marcus and Saks Fifth Avenue. If shopping is your thing, you won't have far to cart your new treasures. The staff is understandably and appropriately solicitous. And they should be. For the price, an extremely helpful staff in not a nicety, but a given. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. Obviously, everything was clean and reasonably state of the art. There were many remote control features, my favorite being the television that could be accessed from the bathtub. (The technology was slightly old, but still very nice.) The bed was extremely comfortable, the room reasonably quiet considering it looked out onto the traffic of Michigan Avenue. The hall noise was non-existent. Room service was quick and efficient, and the food was acceptable, if not mouth-wateringly delicious. My son had high praise for the club sandwich with avocado and egg, but not having tasted it personally, I really can't comment. We dined at the Michelin Two Stars Avenues restaurant. It is the pride of the Peninsula, and it's a pretty decent restaurant if you enjoy adventurous eating. If not, I'd say skip it. Our bill for three people - this includes four alcoholic beverages - was over $600.00. So...this was a pre-fixe menu, and included roughly eight courses of Very Unique food. Amazing presentation, amazing service...Very Unique food. This is the type of thing one probably encounters on very upscale cooking shows, but rarely encounters in their everyday life. I'm glad I tried it, but a little bit of sea urchin goes a long way. Capiche? We ate breakfast one morning in the lobby restaurant, and I would have to say that those orders of Eggs Benedict and that bowl of oatmeal were pretty lackluster. I don't mind paying for things if they hold merit, but I don't like to be taken any more than the next person, and the day that a few skimpy plates of eggs and overcooked hash browns combined with a bowl of oatmeal and berries equals out to over $80.00 - well, that's a sad day in my culinary digest. Anyway, the hotel owns a far better breakfast and lunch cafe adjacent to the lower level of the hotel, and it's a much better choice for casual and tasty dining. So, in closing, the Peninsula is a fine enough hotel, but certainly nothing for bargain hunters. The location is probably it's most pertinent distinction, but clearly it's a top notch hotel as well. Just bring your wallet, and be prepared to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and outstanding! I wish I could stay here forever”
Reviews.Author: YoshiDus
Reviews.Content: We had the great pleasure to stay at this really wonderful hotel for 7 nights in July 2011 during a short summer trip to Chicago. I am a big fan of the Peninsula chain of hotels. Having stayed in Peninsula hotels in Bangkok and New York our expectations were somewhat high and the Peninsula Chicago absolutely fulfilled them. The location is one of the best in Chicago right on Michigan Avenue. The lobby and the property are gorgeous. Staff was extremely friendly, professional and welcoming. Our room on the 8th floor looked and smelled like we were the first guests in it. Immaculate clean, no spots, everything as accurate as you would expect it from one of the worlds-best hotel-chains. Housekeeping did a great job twice a day. The room itself was huge, more like a junior-suite in other hotels with a separate dressing-area and a walk in closet. We slept excellent. There was absolute no sound from outside or the other rooms on your floor. There was plenty of storage room and closet space. The marble bathroom absolute perfect and clean. Robes, slippers and the really wonderful Davi bath-products added up to the experience. Our room did not provide much of a view but it was OK for us. A big plus is the location and the Concierge Service. Many thanks to Garry Schneider, one the concierges, who really provided exceptional service and suggested many hidden restaurants and trips of the beaten track. Personally I appreciated the small things that makes this hotel a 5* one: shoe-trees in your shoes after complimentary shoe-shine, collar-sticks with the hotel logo on it in your shirt after laundry and so on. Overall I would highly recommend The Peninsula for your Chicago visit. There is only one small negative to mention: the pool looks much better on the pictures than in nature, but who cares about a pool in Chicago?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: OpelikaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I've stayed at a Peninsula Hotel and It met my expectations and more. Every staff member from the front desk to houskeeping was obviously extrememly well trained to provide outstanding customer service. While the rate was very pricey, it was worth the money because of the impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarkOrmondBeach
Reviews.Content: Top quality property with superb service and luxurious room. Spa was excellent, as was the breakfast in the lobby restaurant complete with a string quartet. We had a child with us that was also catered to with special treats in the room on arrival. Concierge also very helpful with directions and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “As usual, tip top”
Reviews.Author: Kuni1407
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 days. Coming back to the Peninsula after 3 years was as it has to be: the "welcome back" greeting, the service, the summer special upgrade to an executive suite (awsome bathroom with a view on Michigan avenue), the environment and not to forget the service. Special mention for reception and concierge who had always a listing ear and ready to make your stay as confortable as you wish. So, for me it was good "to be back". If you want a hotel without negative surprises with a stable level of (very) good quality of service, do not hesitate. Try out also the food from the Shanghai Terrace or The Lobby (yes I skipped Avenues because I did not want to have dinner alone, but I tried it out previously and it was good). The Peninsula is may be not the cheapest around :), but price/quality it suits me perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Top Notch Service, but Smelly Room”
Reviews.Author: AllSpark1
Reviews.Content: Ultra-Luxurious Hotel. Beautiful room. Outstanding top notch service. The pool at the top of the hotel with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Michigan Avenue is one-of-a-kind awesomeness. The thing that killed it though, was the stale, dirty-sock odor that pervaded our room during our 4 day stay : ( It was VERY unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, not without kinks, however”
Reviews.Author: sandatucson
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula is in the heart of the City, a heartbeat away from the famous shopping stores like Sax 5th Ave., Nordstrom Rack, etc. This is a plush hotel and we enjoyed the executive suite we stayed in. Excellent staff, very helpful. I had one meal in the room, and I did not think it was particularly great. I had a drink ( 4 glasses of wine in total were consumed) with a friend and the bill was $44 for Pino Grigio. The cell phone reception from our suite was practically non- exixstant ( I use Verizon) and the WIFI was terrible. I was constantly bounced of and finally they had to just connect me with a dsl connection. I am not sure that if I had to pay for a hotel I would choose it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money to an extent......”
Reviews.Author: ohiorona
Reviews.Content: I must say that you expect to pay to stay at the Peninsula. We got a great deal I just happened to find a night free and discounted nights on top of that. That being said it was worth every penny, as we wanted to be pampered and basically do nothing. This is our 8th trip to Chicago and this was just for the love of the city and of course the food. If you're just there for shopping and never in your room don't stay here because you'd never appreciate the amenities, like the spa, sundeck and pool. They are very customer service oriented, which when I travel I want, and I really can't say a negative thing about our experience except I found it rather odd that they didn't have an ironing board and iron alreadly in your room. Of course as soon as I called down they immediately sent up the iron, ironing board and spray starch, magic sizing etc anything and everything you'd need. That being said there is a reason this is the best hotel in Chicago and I've stayed all the other comparible hotels. Just save up your cash and really look for the deals because at normally $600 a night and up you need to get the most bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: AlvinMonk
Reviews.Content: I attended a wedding this last weekend and decided to also stay at this hotel for four nights to take advantage of a special wedding rate that was extended to me. I had a room on the 15th floor (20 is the top floor I believe) and it had ample view of the city, other large buildings, city life, etc. Proper sun/shade/drapes were in place... although nothing allowed us to escape the blaring sirens that are almost constant in city life. Someone really needs to talk to the Chicago fire department to tone down all the unnecessary noise they make. The room was medium in size, very well laid out with a separate dressing area and very large bathroom. All lights, utilities, furniture, art, rugs, tile, bathroom, etc, were completely modern, clean, and well maintained. Extremely high tech, yet simple to use, lighting, air system, safe, phone, DVD, TV, stereo, tv in bath tub, etc. Makeup mirror, safe, mini bar, etc. They have a one hour service to remove wrinkles in your clothing, or they will bring you: an iron, a board, spray can and spray water... all very clean and now, so your clothes wont be ruined. Turn down service is done nightly. All requests for room clean and do not disturb are electronic and not paper/hang based. We lives strangely in the room and did not want the room cleaned until 7PM each night when we left for dinner. They respected our DO NOT DISTURB electronic sign and never once did they knock or call trying to get us to have the room cleaned. Never once did we hear noise in the hall way, including never hearing any knocks on someone else's door, etc. There were many subtle and not so subtle high tech things throughout the room... each were very impressive and useful. During the room clean, if you had a cable wire plugged in (like a phone charger) they would even ROLL IT UP NICELY as if it was BRAND NEW. Each night during turn down service they also set your slippers on each side of the bed and placed them on a cloth mat. The bathrobes were long enough for a change, very clean, and very comfortable. The towels were extremely white, plush, and perfect in every way. There was a scale, hair blower, and plenty of high quality soap/shampoo. The service was incredible in every way. If you ask someone where something is, they TAKE YOU THERE. We requested a 2PM check out time and that was not a problem at all. The SPA was very clean and the people who work there are very respectful and helpful in every way. The GYM was constantly being cleaned, even though it was already clean. They offered water and fruit, cold towels, stretching room, modern equipment, yoga paraphernalia, etc. I believe there was a pool, but I did not use it. I will separately review their restaurant and catering food separately... but I will say here that they were all 5 star. I cannot wait to go back and I was unhappy to leave. Lastly, the concierge was dead on with everything they assisted with. This is a DOG FRIENDLY hotel and you will see some of the cutest dogs walking through the lobby... often being walked by a member of the hotel staff, dressed as a bell boy, with white gloves, taking the pooch our for a walk. Very impressive, cube, and RICH!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite spot in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: creardon
Reviews.Content: You feel welcomed the minute you enter the hotel. The staff is friendly, helpful, and professional. Great rooms that you don't want to leave. Spa is great with top notch staff. Always my favorite stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, room and location”
Reviews.Author: fredalynn
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels my wife and I have stayed at during our many years of worldwide travel. The service is impeccable. Highly attentive but not intrusive. Great attention is paid to the most minute details. You don't need to ask for turndown service. What a relief! The concierge desk is knowledgeable and most accommodating. The rooms are are quiet. You are able to concentrate without interruption. This is a hotel run for individuals who are accustomed to a high level of service and know how to appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: mstravelgoddess
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to this city and what a pleasant surprise. Great location and wonderful staff. Nice rooms with modern amenities, beautiful dining room with a piano player but the concierge was what really made it. robert suggested that we take our daughter to the local aquarium and offered us tickets to it, told us hold onto them, if the line is too long use them to go to the front of the line, they were 10$ more per ticket but we did not need to purchase them now, only use them if we needed. Well when we got there not only was there a line but the wait was three hours long! Thank god for Robert because we used those tickets and went straight to the front of the line, had he not given them to us we would of never waited and would of missed out on one of the best aquariums in the world! This hotel is worth the five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-star hotel.. rooms too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: EuroAmerican773
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to throw my own two cents in on all the claims about the Peninsula being a 5-star hotel.. We stayed there one night recently (at the same time Dave Mathews was a guest!) As many locals know, the Peninsula is only a couple of blocks away from Northwestern Memorial Hospital. Ambulances arrive there throughout the day & night. Even on a high floor, the street noise is very apparent in the guest rooms. In this aspect, the Peninsula is no better than any 2 or 3 star hotel. European 5-star hotels I've stayed at have two sets of windows in the guest rooms. Two hotels that come immediately to mind are the Hotel Paris ("Pariz") in Prague & the Berkeley in London. Our rooms in both these hotels had two sets of windows, with a wide air gap in between.. It really makes a difference! Fortunately, I always keep a pair of earplugs in my travel kit, so I was fine. But my friend was a bit annoyed by the constant wail of sirens & made a number of unfriendly remarks about "the city". If street noise isn't a concern, then I would agree that the Peninsula could be considered 5-star. Otherwise, it's 4-star at best. There really isn't any excuse for the hotel to skimp on proper soundproofing for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “It's the best”
Reviews.Author: numberonueve
Reviews.Content: The hotel lives up to the "its the best" reputation. As a native Chicagoan - in town to visit the fam but had a one-night getaway to celebrate our anniversary - I know to appreciate luxury and location. We had a standard room, which was spacious, comfortable and had all the bells and whistles you would find in any 5 star hotel. The pool/hot tub were perfect. The gym was huge with many machines...but that was the one drawback, so many people also appreciated the fully stocked gym that no one paid mind of the people waiting for a treadmill. So I left and went for a walk along the lakeshore, which is just a couple blocks away. Don't forget to shop...you're right in the heart of the Magnificent Mile!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel that keeps us coming back”
Reviews.Author: dandkm88
Reviews.Content: Attentive service, clean and well appointed rooms, fantastic restaurants in the heart of the city. We walked to Millennium Park, the Art Institute, many bars and restaurants, shopping, everywhere! So much more to do than we could possible fit into 3 days. We really could not ask for anything more. Yes, it can be a bit on the pricey side but discounts can be found and the feeling of being in another world is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and super central”
Reviews.Author: Ivana88
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Excellent standard for 5 star status. Enjoyed it very much. Tiffany & co on corner along with all the main shopping areas

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: diverbuds
Reviews.Content: Most fabulous stay ever! Were treated like royalty. Booked though Whatahotel and because we got a complimentary upgrade to a suite with our package, we were entitled to a 3 hour mini cooper drive, including wherever we wanted to shop or see. Avenues restaurant fit for a foodie king! Sit at Chef's table if you can. All in all, best stay of my our lives!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: DietBoost
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel experience. The room was impeccable, clean and thoughtfully set up - the TV/lighting/climate controls next to the bed was incredibly convenient and useful. Everyone - from check-in, the concierge to the valet - went out of their way to make our hotel experience absolutely perfect. There was a certain warmth to the staff and their efforts to make our stay a wonderful experience. By way of example, my wife was waiting for me near the front desk, when a woman sitting across from her coughed a couple of times. Immediately, the person at the front desk asked her if she needed some water. That's just one example of the incredible service at this hotel. That's in addition to the incredible lobby and the perfect rooms. I will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The world's best bed and incidentially a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PFoggSydney
Reviews.Content: Flawless. Excellent Service. Front desk and Concierge were utterly professional. The Chinese restaurant was as good as the best in China. The breakfasts were top notch. The Executive Suite was wonderfully comfortable for our week long stay. The suite came with 3 hours in the Pen mini, which was fun. An excellent swimming pool. But even given all that, the very best bit was the bed. It was the most comfortable bed in the world. I still dream about it. The location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing. Tip: Any tour by the Chicago Architecture Foundation will be worth it http://caf.architecture.org/

Reviews.Title: “Beyond outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Robengar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding during Memorial day weekend. The hotel's public areas are very beautiful and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. We would recommend the formal afternoon tea. The service at this hotel is second to none. Even the housekeeping staff went above and beyond anything we have ever experienced.
