This included hanging up and/or folding clothes that had been left in the changing area and even rolling up power cords that were left on the desk. The bathroom had a large soaking tub with a tv. The views of Lake Michigan and Michigan avenue are great. This is by far our favorite hotel in Chicago and we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: acagreene
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula is absolutely gorgeous and the service is impeccable. They truly go out of their way to make you happy. The room was gorgeous and quite spacious and I could have stayed in the oh-so-comfy bed for days. Soft sheets and down covers..... wow. The bathroom was massive and had everything you could need. The attention to detail by the housekeeping folks was truly impressive as well. Every time we came back to the room, everything was put away "just so." The hotel itself is located in a prime location. Right across from our window was Neiman Marcus and I was able to walk to various landmarks each day. Chicago is a great city and, if you can afford it, the Peninsula is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Preposterous
Reviews.Content: 100 plus delegates were effortlessly handled for three days. Service discrete and accommodating at a surprisingly competitive price. Organised similar meetings in several cities - this was special. Rooms excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch all the way!”
Reviews.Author: owehay2
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel is exquisite. I would stay here every visit to Chicago...if I could afford it. We got a great corporate rate during our stay and I continue to look for deals on this hotel to go back again. You can't beat the location and the details put into the rooms are just top notch. I met 3 celebrities during my stay...great for sighting VIP's of the world. Plus the spa is to die for! If you go in the summer...plan a day just to lay out outside on the spa deck. BEAUTIFUL views! Only negative, our check in process was unnecessarily long and the check in staff was snooty. EVERYthing else was so superb that we quickly forgot our checkin experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula is well located in the main part of Chicago. Close to shops and restaurants. It's easy to get to all the main parts of Chicago CBD in less than 20 minutes. Positives: Room size; service (very efficient); location. FREE WIFI. Negatives: None except entrance to the hotel is a mystery of design. Why hide the reception up an elevator on another floor? A mystery but it does not impact on a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing else to say except that the Peninsula was perfection”
Reviews.Author: hotski7
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, at 10:00am on Friday, and were greeted warmly by Klara, to the time we left on Sunday, we marveled at the opulence of the hotel. The rooms were beautiful and large, the location perfect, and the overall attention to detail unmatched... The hotel was worth every penny. After checking out we enjoyed a wonderful brunch in the main restaurant, and that too was worth the $75 price tag. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: NYLady4
Reviews.Content: It is no surprise that the Peninsula Chicago systemically gets annual acclaim -- it is a beautiful, service-oriented hotel in the heart of Chicago. While there are some little things that can use updating (i.e. the TVs affixed to the bathtub are old), there really is nothing to complain about with this hotel. The gym is one of the nicest hotel gyms I have ever seen (and I have seen a lot), and the lap pool is fantastic with a great view. While in town I did have an opportunity to check out the new(er) Trump hotel a few blocks away where a friend was staying -- also gorgeous, so probably worthwhile doing a price compare before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved 99.99 percent!”
Reviews.Author: psconcierge
Reviews.Content: We had to attend a party at the Peninsula, so decied to stay overnight. Had a roomy wonderful deluxe suite facing East to Michigan Ave and the lake, North up Michigan Ave and the Lake and south down Michigan Ave. Check in was great, informative and friendly. Brought up to room and mentioned we needed a few things (pants pressed, shoes shined,) and that was taken care of immediately. While my friend went to the spa, I just relaxed in the room. Went to get a cup of espresso from the in room Nespresso machine, but could not get it to work. Called someone who verifyed I was doing it all correctly. Turns out it was unplugged. I could not move the large desk/mini bar, so it was taken care of while we were out. The party was wonderful, the room beautiful the food fantastic (drinks too!) Wonderful sleep. Next morning had breakfast in the lobby restaurant. We both ordered Eggs Benedict. My friend doesn't eat potatoes, so aksed for none. But was not offered any options such as fruit, tomatoes anything. Should have been offered without asking. So except for the two small inconveniences, it was a great stay. I would recommend it wholdeheartedly!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Fell in love with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: philatravelgirl_11
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Chicago and I managed a great internet package on the Peninsula website. The hotel is well situated to shopping and attractions - the Art Institute, Grant Park, River tours, Navy Pier are all within 15-20 mins walking. The staff in the hotel is the best! The Concierge team is outstanding - no other team can compare in my travels thus far. Prior to my visit, they sent me a listing of all recommended restaurants in the area at all price ranges including a diner and Whole Foods On site, they made reservations, confirmed by in room fax and provided their mobile numbers in case I needed them while I was out exploring the city. The hotel offers free wi-fi in the room which always had a strong signal. Free access to the gym and classes - the class instructors were wonderful. I managed two classes during my stay which were hard workouts and usually had about five students in a private room with a view of the city. The Pierre Gourmet on the ground floor served a good breakfast, amazing pastries and chocolates to bring home to the family. I ordered a room service burger and it was one of the best ever! The room was a good size/layout. I loved the controls next to the bed and the outside temp readout by the door. The housekeeping staff - Wow! I had my various chargers on the desk, I came back and they were all organized with rubber bands around the wires. I had clothes on top of my suitcase and came back to find they were folded and inside the suitcase. So many little touches that were unexpected but appreciated This is a hotel I didn't want to leave but alas i did need to see the city of Chicago. There is so much I didn't get to do or use in my 3 day stay but there is always next time....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best near the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: dadofgirliegirls
Reviews.Content: I don't typically stay in $600/night hotels, but they have an American Girl package that gives you gifts for the kids' dolls, custom embroidered pillowcases and very nice dessert package. My girls absolutely loved it and the fact that the American Girl store is 2 blocks away was a dream. The hotel is in a great location and the service is awesome. The only drawback is the price, but then again, this is a full service, luxury, family friendly hotel - so you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: june576
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsula in April for a week to celebrate a Wedding Anniversary. We were expecting something special But I have to say that our expectations were exceeded by some way. The hotel is beautiful and the staff excellent. Nothing was too much trouble for them and the hotel room was just wonderful with every facility that you could want. The spa and pool were also fabulous - we had great difficulty in persuading our 5 year old son to get out of the pool each day. Food in the restaurants was also very good and the location of the hotel would be hard to beat in Chicago as it is located just off the Magnificent Mile in the hub of everything. Although it is expensive - you only get what you pay for. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience,highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: welltraveled77
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for shopping and restaurants. The service was outstanding. Employees were always willing to help without being "in your face". The concierge Todd is the best anywhere. Nothing negative to say.

Reviews.Title: “Discerning accommodation with Eastern flair straight on NoMi”
Reviews.Author: Priv_Dis_Lux
Reviews.Content: Got in Chicago and had a Grand Room at this perfectly located Hotel. Usual attentiveness in the service and friendliness of the staff and particularly of the Japanese receptionist escorting me to the accommodation.Extremely pleasant room on the 12 floor up to the high standards of this chain. Dressing area, marble bathroom with separate bathtub and shower with wine scented toiletries. Welcome fruit platter was really appreciated. King bed of outstanding comfort due to its quality (Simmons ). Outstanding common areas and interesting SPA at the top floor. Regarding bfast I dislike non buffet offerings and I will not provide my review on this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Rooms-Great Location-Ok Service”
Reviews.Author: Jobo59
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Penninsula in Hong Kong which in my book is what all Hotels in this 5 star category should be measured against in all aspects so we were excited to give this Hotel a shot in Chicago. We came away overall with a great stay and were not disappointed. There were however some shortcomings that we felt did not put them at the 5 star level (more like 4.5) since 5 star really means near or at perfection. For example, we had a waiter for tea in the lobby (Reuben) that did not know how to smile and was slow; we had the same experience on two different occasions in the venue area where the service was slow to realize you were seated and slow to accomodate. Food was great though. Spa service and facilities were also excellent (we stayed at hotel for 5 days so we really experienced a lot). Housekeeping also fell a little short. For example, we had a suite with a hide-a-bed that our daughter slept on and on second night turn-down service failed to show up so we had to pull the hide-a-bed out ourselves which had no sheets so we had to call for them to come make up the bed (why they stripped it from the night before I have no idea). Again, not a huge huge deal, but something a five star should not miss. Certainly would stay again, but at their rates I might also give Trump a try or Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “THe best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: HelloHorsey27
Reviews.Content: While some people may turn their noses up because they have been better places, I thought the Peninsula was WONDERFUL! The service was incredible, the people were kind, the views were spectacular, and the location was superb. The beds were comfortable, and we appreciated the complimentary food in our room at the end of each long (and awesome) day. This hotel was absolutely wonderful, down to the smallest detail. The breakfasts were the meals of a lifetime, and I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “the difference between one five-star and another is the details...”
Reviews.Author: andergtr
Reviews.Content: and the peninsula proves to me why it is considered one of the best hotels in the country, and certainly the best in chicago. i usually stay at the trump, and that is a wonderful hotel that i love and would stay at again, but the peninsula's staff and their attention to detail is in a different class. several other travelers already mentioned the control center device on the nightstand, but it really makes sense. little things, like the staff communicating via your personal fax machine and having a small light illuminate on the control center when there was a message on the fax, were what made the difference. you got the feeling that the they were always available, but never intrusive. other things, like asking them to send up silverware and napkins when i brought back takeout from a restaurant, or ordering pizza and having the staff deliver it to my room, were indicative of a place that valued not only the privacy but the security of its guests. niggles? ok, the room isn't as spacious and modern as the trump. and the toiletries aren't as nice, either. but if you've stayed in enough five-star places, you know that you can get the same level of room decor and size at a hilton, but you don't get the same quality of sheets or attention to detail in housekeeping. a female friend came to visit, and i gave her a set of the slippers they use for turndown. the next day, another set came. when i decided to use the cloth laundry bag for my dirty clothes, another one was placed in the same place as the old one. to see if this was a fluke, i took the next set and hid them in a drawer. they replaced them again. at other places i've stayed, you get one set, and that's it. it's little things like that that show that housekeeping is paying attention to the little things. clothes, for example, were always neatly folded if they were sitting out. shoes were placed back in the closet. the indoor lap pool and the whirlpool were wonderful, and i would recommend bringing a swimsuit to take advantage of this. other things? free internet access, which is huge because if you're like me, you travel with a work laptop and an ipad. if you have to pay for internet access, you end up paying twice if you want wi-fi. for this level of hotel, internet should be included. also, every room has a personal fax machine and number, so you can send and receive faxes. the machine doubles as a copier, as well, which is helpful when you need to scan something fast. you can also smoke in the room (assuming it's a smoking room), unlike the trump. again, that's a huge thing for me when you want to unwind after a long business day and have a nice cohiba. absolutely the best stay i've had in chicago. i am back in a few weeks for leisure, and i'll be back at the peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Service”
Reviews.Author: nhdb
Reviews.Content: It is easy for a five-star hotel to be a pleasure to stay at when all goes smoothly - the real test is when everything goes wrong. I traveled to Chicago on what was supposed to be an overnight business trip that turned into a six-night stay due to a sudden client emergency. I had only brought one change of clothes with me and, as it turned out, the hotel was fully booked for the days after my first night's stay - all at a time when I was working around the clock due to the client emergency. The hotel staff rose magnificently to the occasion - my clothes were cleaned and neatly pressed for me every morning, and hung with care in my closet. In addition, depite the hotel being fully booked, they assured me they would find a place and within an hour called me to let me know that they had found another room for me and would move my things. All in all, the staff made a seamless pleasure out of what was a very stressful week in my professional life.

Reviews.Title: “it doesn't get any better than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hsg130
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were scheduled to go to new york the week of january 24. as we were boarding the plane, all flights into la guardia were cancelled due to the weather. we're from atlanta and were packed for really cold weather so we decided to go to chicago. air tran could not have been more accomodating; they charged us nothing extra to change flights and put us in first class to boot. we have stayed in some very elegant hotels but had never stayed in a peninsual property. the hotel was running a third night free package; we booked through our amex platinum card, which includes a one room upgrade; we were upgraded to an executive corner suite; i think it was 750 sq feet.; it worked out to approximately $375 per night. the room was magnificent; the service in the hotel was extraordinary; the hotel is immaculate; the location is perfect. the suite also came with a complimentary car and driver for 3 hours to drive us where we wanted to go and to wait for us; how incredible is that? ask for robert in concierge; top notch person to deal with. if your plans include going to chicago, do not miss the opportunity to stay in this hotel. you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Profoundly Good”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: The Penninsula is quickly challenging if not surpassing both The Four Seasons and The Ritz Carlton for a few very important reasons: 1. Staff attends to guests in an old-school manner that is both gracious and intelligent. 2. Rooms are large, beautiful, comfortable, and surprising... 3. Surprises: many small details both in the rooms and elsewhere amount to a feeling of happiness and ease-of-living. For example, the way the flat screen TV swivels to face the bed; the lighting in the spa; the palm trees in the lobby. I can't imagine a better urban luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star in every way”
Reviews.Author: MichelinFoodie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4 times over the past 2 years, every stay has been perfect. Best location right off Michigan Ave close to all the shopping and dining, very large rooms for the city, and service is always exceptional. Much better than the Four Seasons Chicago where I stayed on one occasion and later regretted. Afternoon tea is fantastic. Used the fitness center (free) which was one of the best I've seen in any hotel. Can't think of anything they could do better, they nail all the small details.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: prpro70
Reviews.Content: I held a corporate meeting at the hotel for 30 and had the pleasure of staying the night. The hotel staff was amazing (Kenneth the concierge rocked and the ELV technician LENT his personal flash drive to me for 24 hours when my work flash drive died!). The rooms were gorgeous -- traditional contemporary and the bathrooms were the stuff of my HGTV fantasies. Loved the oversized tub and the TV facing it. The room was a nice size (not overly spacious but decent), the bed linens were so soft and comfortable. I came back after hosting a dinner for 35 outside of the hotel and experienced fantastic service in the hotel bar. Even received a "on-the-house" champagne refill when I said I was going back to soak in my tub. Not sure if it was the champagne, the tub or the great bed but it was the best night's sleep I had in a long time. Thank you Peninsula. I will be back this summer when I plan my next in town "stay-cation".

Reviews.Title: “OUR FAMILY FAVORITE”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelSnob
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula Chicago is one of our favorite's when we visit Chicago. The adults love it, the pamper the children and make them feel so special so it's certainly great for kids and it's close to the Mag Mile where we love to shop. It's a luxury hotel with a luxury price but after being out all day in the heat or cold, I just wanna head to my spacious accommodations, take a nice hot bath/shower and crawl into a comfortable bed with soft, high thread count linen with everything I want or need just a phone call away. The gym and pool are fantastic and if you REALLY want to treat yourself, then go to the SPA! When you check out it'll put a dent in your pocket, but also leave a big smile on your face.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Professor44
Reviews.Content: With large, quiet, well-designed, refurbished rooms and excellent service, this hotel is better than others I have stayed in including the Four Seasons, Intercontinental, Hilton, and Hyatt. My room on the 18th floor had a hallway that led to an alcove with closet and storage area (for luggage) on the right and off that was the bathroom complete with separate shower. The bedroom was large and well-equipped. Service was impeccable, as was the decor. Just excellent in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: helloashley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsula Chicago for two nights for a work conference. The hotel is beautiful and has many thoughtful amenities for guests. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, with free Internet (too many 4 star hotels neglect to offer this) The beds were very comfortable, although I personally advise asking housekeeping for additional linens because the bed has only a comforter on it and nothing else, so if you want a lighter sheet or blanket, it's not in the room. For sending messages to your room (about housekeeping, etc) they send a message to the fax machine in your room. The thermostat for this room is a little odd. It's located next to the phone next to your bed! The bathroom has a separate area for the toilet, a shower stall, and a bath. The bath was great, with a separate showerhead for washing off, it was large to comfortably lie down in, and it faces towards a TV. Service is impeccable, whether it's with housekeeping, restaurant staff, or concierge. My only complaint with this hotel is that the catered food for our business meeting was not as good as it could have been. For example, our group was only offered coffee, tea, or water during our meeting, no selection of soft drinks or juices. The breakfast selection was small (eggs, toast, bread, croissants only). And the reception dinner could not be classified as a dinner (it was casual, h'orderves style, but pasta & bread only is NOT dinner! plus two drink tickets, and they took your drink ticket when you got a soft drink or a water) Overall, it was a beautiful hotel and I enjoyed staying there, but I think there is room for improvement when it comes to the food offered for meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect indulgence with my granddaughter”
Reviews.Author: n_bi-coastal
Reviews.Content: Took my 8-yr-old granddaughter for a 4 day adventure in Chicago. Informed the Peninsula that it was her birthday, and they treated her like the Princess she'd like to imagine....They sent a large platter of happy birthday sweets/famous popcorn/cards/truffles...In addition, shortly after we arrived, housekeeper appeared with a terry robe and slippers in my granddaughter's size. The Concierge remembered her name and called out to her everytime we passed. Housekeeping also artfully arranged the stuffed animal that had accompanied us on different pillows twice a day...very cute..The Peninsula package included breakfast for two either in the room or in the restaurant. Once she discovered the flat screen tv in front of the bathtub, I never thought I'd get her out of the hotel. It was a perfect hotel for creating memories.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: abbey_315
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsula for 3 nights with our 5 month old baby and the hotel, staff, everything was wonderful! The hotel is beautiful, and in a great location. The lobby restaurant food was fantastic, we ate lunch and breakfasts there and thoroughly enjoyed the leisurely experience of it. Every detail of this hotel is amazing! We LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: verdegallardo
Reviews.Content: This is what other hotels should strive for. Lobby, and hotel in general is beautiful and staff is very nice and polite without being pretentious. I stayed here with my wife for our anniversary and they upgraded my room for free, and also had complimentary chocolate covered strawberries and red wine waiting in the room. The chocolate bar was very enjoyable, but man I wanted to kick myself after it thinking of all the calories I just ate! My only complaint is the cost. A rather small room (especially for the price) plus the chocolate bar for two ended up almost a grand for a one night stay. Plus valet parking is $50.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: LENGLAND12
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my wife and had a great experience. Even though the room rates will kill your wallet, the overall experience is absolutely wonderful; you really are getting what you paid for. I decided to go for the cheaper rooms, a double suite. Even though it was one of the cheaper rooms, it was still luxurious. The bed was soft, with numerous pillows, down blankets and sheets. Amenities such as a universal remote control, responsible for the radio, television, phone, alarm clock, etc. was at my disposal. The bathroom was awesome. Bathing while watching ESPN was particularly fun. Plush towels and good quality toiletries (instead of the generic hotel conditioners, toothpaste, etc.) were a definite plus. Room service was prompt and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ckgosch
Reviews.Content: Like all the Peninsula Hotels, this is a beautiful property with an outstanding staff. The location makes for a great spot for either business or leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: lucinjo
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago to catch up with family and friends, unfortunately we chose Lollapalooza weekend so the city and hotel were packed with people. The Penisula did a fabulous job, from the first minute we arrived. From the fast check-in to the beautifully designed room (we especially liked the wall mounted reading lights over the bed and the TV which could adjust more than 90 degrees, so you could watch from the bed or the sofa) to the great facilities it was a great time. The manager sent truffles to our room. Our rate included $100 to be used for incidentals. We met friends both in the bar and on the terrace for drinks, service was outstanding. For breakfast, we skipped the lobby restaurant and went to street level to Pierrot Gourmet for a wonderful outdoor meal. The concierge was extremely helpful with making dinner reservations on the spur of the moment. Location was terrific just south of Water Tower and just off Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Planet”
Reviews.Author: Maralora
Reviews.Content: We still talk about our great stay there and are still enjoying the fabulous products we purchased while visiting their Spa. This is not the place you go to save money or stay on a budget. It is expensive and worth every penny! I would rather save all year for 2 nights there then to go on a week's vacation somewhere that could never be as remarkable. The service we were given was beyond the meaning of customer service...we felt like Royalty. My daughter and I enjoyed our stay so much that we are planning to return again next year even if it's for one night or two. Fabulous time, fabulous service, and we felt like New Women when we left. This was a life changing experience. Highly recommended for women especially...girlfirends, mother and daughter, etc. You won't regret it. Also, recommend the spa pkg as even though it is more costly per night you get more than your money's worth for not doing it the ala carte way.

Reviews.Title: “A giant splurge but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: KathySShermanOaks_CA
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Chicago, we were wanted to make it an excellent experience, starting with the Peninsula. If you are able to save on airfare, use your extra $$ to stay here. Everything about it is outstanding-location, service, super clean and luxurious rooms. The only problem was the sirens going by at night. The dessert buffet in the lobby at night looked spectacular but we managed to control ourselves : ) Nothing about this hotel is inexpensive, so be prepared for a huge bill. The fitness center was outstanding as was the spa, but spa appointments need to be booked in advanced.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: skadudie
Reviews.Content: In Chicago on business and stayed here for the first time. This is just a sensational hotel in every way. The service is spectacular and the hotel, well, matches the service. I did not have the opportunity to dine here, though I certainly would have liked to. Tremendous concierge program and a great location off Michigan Ave---just a great spot to be in this beautiful city by the lake. My room was super, clean to a tee, great bathroom, amenities, decor and views. Confortable bed? Of course. Excelllent. Expensive? Yes. How could it not be. Without doubt one of the very best hotels in the Unites States in my view. The kind of place you feel bad about leaving. A fantasy world in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SandraSJ
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, good location, nice staff, good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: IOMGEOFF
Reviews.Content: Great location, overlooking Michigan Ave but be prepared for street noise of hooking and sirens due to close proximity to many hospitals. Opulent hotel and well presented. Room: 1115 grand deluxe 2 queen beds, good size room and large bathroom with separate bath and shower and plentiful toiletries. Excellent maid service. On arrival we found the bath did not hold water, hair dryer did not work, shower head loose and electric socks loose on walls. But to be fair these matters were resolved within an hour of us contacting reception. We requested a room in a quiet position, and were given a room facing the staff floor entrance, which meant constant banging of door. Was disappointed that there was not drink making facilities in the room, considering the cost. We also found that the room was not well sound proofed. When our credit card was swiped on arrival, they put it on 'hold' so we were unable to use it in shops. Be aware and bring a second card. We also found it inconvenient that you had to take a lift from the ground floor which was excessively slow to the lobby/reception area. Compared to other hotels the number of floors are limited rooms up to the 18th floor only, next time we would try taller hotel more than likely Trump Towers due to its position and scale. Overall, found more bad points than good points.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in America-redux”
Reviews.Author: hotelfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply perfect. Its rooms and their amenities, the location, staff, service, fitness center, business center, roof top pool, room service, dining options and bar are all spectacular. They think of everything including the weight of the towels, the count of the sheets, the free and fast wi-fi, the free bottles of water, and every other indulgence one could ask for. This place is expensive but they do not nickel and dime you once you check in. This is I think my 5th visit and I'd sell my house and become a permanent resident if it were economically feasible. I stayed in a deluxe double with my 15 year old daughter which gave us a west facing view, 700 square feet, two beds, and an incredible bathroom with 2 vanities, a separate bathtub and shower, a TV at the foot of the tub-which is equipped so that you can talk on the phone while you watch TV and bathe. Everybody should do that once. We were taken under the wing of the superbly competent and extremely kind Lee Ann Brown, the director of guest services, who is wonderful and looked after us in every way. The hotel is great for a walk on the Magnificent Mile as it fronts it. We explored Michigan Ave., Millenium Park, The Chicago River Architectural Tour, and The Art Institute, all easy walks from the hotel. We had the fantastic prix fixed buffet lunch and thought it was delicious and a remarkable value. After visiting us several times during our stay, my oldest friend who resides in Lake Forest has decided to check in to his own room when we inevitably, and I hope really soon, return to The Pen. I simply cannot recommend any property-anywhere-higher than The Peninsula Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding in every way!”
Reviews.Author: redwing1
Reviews.Content: great property. perfect location on mag mile. close to everything, walked everywhere. service excellent--all employees go out of there way to talk to you. decor is beautiful, rooms very comfortable with all amenities. in addition to a box of welcome chocolates, they left popcorn, gummie bears and a huge cookie for my son the first night. as close to a perfect city hotel as you can get. would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Peninsula - simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: evoLotlevarT
Reviews.Content: Room 1627 over the Memorial Day weekend. I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and the Four Seasons here in Chicago and they donâ€™t even come close to the Pen. This hotel and their staff are exceptional! The rooms are luxurious with large bathrooms featurein spererate tubs, shower and WC. There is a TV in front of the tub, a sitting area for the ladies and a lighting systems that took almost 3 days to figure out! They do not nickel & dime you on the extras like free internet which was fast and ample complimentary water bedside when turndown service was performed. The Spa is a bit small but quite nice along with a narrow lap pool, hot tub, and small sun deck on the 19th floor facing east with stunning views of Water Tower Place. The Bar is well stocked, but expensive. We ate only in the Lobby Lounge for a late lunch and everything was quite good. The public areas are terrific, on the modern side with dramatic staircases. Special thanks to Kenneth, our concierge who recommended a very good restaurant. We canâ€™t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newmoongirl
Reviews.Content: Went a few years ago with work (I worked in Travel Ind), the staff cant do enough, the hotel is great and very luxurious! Central in Chicago, brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jmk5
Reviews.Content: I wish all hotels were as good as this one. The room was not large, but was large enough for one or two people. The detailing in the room was fantastic. The bed was extremely confortable--one of the best I ever been in. The television and entertainment system was top notch. There was good channel selection, a fantastic TV, a way to hitch all of your electronics up, DVD player, separate, TV, phone and radio in the tub. There was also a wonderful dressing area with seating, drawers and the closet outside the bathroom. Very well thought out and very tasefully done. The pool spa area was quite large for a Downtown Chicago hotel. There was an outdoor patio, indoor pool and hot tub, and steam room. Throughout the facility there were complentary water and tea. Robes and swimming togs were provided. I really enjoyed the use of these facilities. The food was fantastic. I was at the hotel for a conference, and the breakfasts, lunches and buffet dinner were of the highest quality. All of the food and drinks were fantastic. In "The Bar", I had a drink called the French 77. It was maticiculously made and delicious. The Chinese resturant made perfect tea. Not over extracted. I've never had tea made that perfectly in the United States. The service was excellent. The hotel provided a complimentary shoe shine. I called for that service. The lady said there would be someone there within 10 minutes. She was there in 2 minutes. I requested an ironing board to touch up my clothes from packing. The board was there in 2 minutes with an iron and complimentary spray starch delivered in a basket with an ironing towel. Bottled water with a glass was provided with the turndown service. I could go on, but the hotel had wonderful, thoughtful rooms, excellent service, beautiful facilities, and excellent food and drink. The best thing was that most of the added touches were complimentary. I wasn't charged for water, tea, spray starch, or other things in the facility. The Beverly Hilton (see my recent review of that hotel) could learn a lot from this place. I have not had service this good outside of Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kazm76
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel. We thought our hotel in New York was fantastic, we couldn't believe it when we got to our room at the Peninsula. The rooms were massive. You could live here they were that big. The rooms were well appointed, very modern, awesome bathroom. We only stayed two nights but could have stayed longer. It is also in a great location, very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Return Trip”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMogul
Reviews.Content: My wife surprised me with a overnight-er to The Peninsula in Chicago, for my birthday the weekend of Mother's Day. We had recently been to the same property a month earlier and loved it. I have to say that the property is amazing but the service this time left much to be desired. My wife had planned that a couple trays of chocolates, fruit, and nuts be in the room upon arrival. We we arrived and checked in she had to call down and remind them that she ordered these items:strike one. She had also communicated with the staff to have a special cake prepared as a surprise for my birthday, a red velvet cake that was supposed to feed eight people. Upon our finishing dinner in the Asian restaurant in the hotel the brought out a smaller cake that said "Happy Birthday Jason"....my name is Jerry. So I kindly pointed out to them that there probably was a Jason expecting this cake since my name isn't Jason and the cake was wrong. They apologized and cam back with the correct cake which beautifully ready "Happy Birthday Jeremy". We laughed it off and ate the cake. Strike two. Upon finishing dinner the staff were to have placed the cake in a pastry cooler until our departure in the morning. Well....when we checked out they basically lost the cake. It took them about a half an hour to find it. Strike three. No all of there are not major blunders but when you take into consideration that we spent about $1000 for an overnight stay at this property it begs the question: Was it worth it?. I would say that in comparison to the Drake or The Hilton towers it was not. I would have preferred to stay at either of those properties or even the Wit for about $250 a night. The Peninsula need to focus a little better on execution if they want to maintain the reputation that they have earned over the years. I must say that I will not be staying there again soon. Jerry Bloom

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, and a (known) gem”
Reviews.Author: Srcolb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, having been there many times before, and loved it. I was at the hotel for only 2 nights, having traveled to Chicago to see "The Addams Family" in previews, at the Oriental Theatre. I have but not one bad thing to say about this hotel. It's located in a superb area, the staff is beyond remarkable, the food, the rooms, the beds, the technologicaly-kept aspects were all in tact, and elegant, glamorous, and most of all enjoyable as always.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PalmBeach9
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,excellent service, good food. Right off Michigan Ave. The rooms was very well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a business trip. The hotel is on the 6th floor, so you enter at the bellhop area, then have to take a ride in an elevator, then have to shlep down a marble hallway and turn left before you even see the check in desk. Other than that the hotel is very swanky. The rooms are large and well appointed. The bathrooms are lovely. The price to stay there is astronomical. If a business wasn't paying for it I don't see how the normal person could justify the $550/night cost. If we were being put up again in Chicago and it was at this hotel, I would be a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place”
Reviews.Author: German_Party_of_Six
Reviews.Content: This review will be short, because all I wanted is to let you know, that this place is flawless. The room was beautiful, the staff is friendly and competent, the hotel is most elegant and the gym is fully equipped and has a beautiful view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Impressive”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: This is a grand old property. The location is perfect. The service excels. Matt Damon was rumored to be on the property while I was there. The Peninsula is a unique brand of luxury. It's an experience worth having at least once. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star and all that goes with it”
Reviews.Author: J_Plus_L_4Ever
Reviews.Content: Even though we live in Chicago, my wife and I rented a room for fun after a gala event in the hotel ballroom. Pretty much everything about the hotel is 5-star. All of the staff are extremely courteous. The place is quite upscale and perhaps a bit stuffy in my opinion, though it's fun if you want to enjoy the royal treatment. The location of the hotel is fantastic if you want to hang around downtown Chicago. It's just steps away from Michigan avenue with all of the shopping on the magnificent mile, the art galleries, Millennium park, etc. Like most locals we don't spend a lot non-work time downtown, but we had fun and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Peninsula. It was our first stay at a Peninsula hotel. The common areas are beautiful (substantially nicer than at the Four Seasons) and the rooms are spacious and very nice. The room size was very comfortable. The washroom was also beautiful with nice touches such as a tv next to the tub. The gym facilities were very good. We had room service one evening, and the food was excellent. It would be hard to find much to complain about with this hotel. If you do not find a special or discounted price, it is quite pricey. That being said, this is a very top notch hotel and I would have no reservations staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another incredible stay at the Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: cobramax
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our annual visit to Chicago the weekend after Thanksgiving and, as we have experienced each and every time we have stayed at the Peninsula in Chicago, everyone from the bellman to the receptionist to the maids were so attentive and kind that you felt special during every single interaction. The room and the service were flawless, the front desk personnel, the concierge, and the bellmen remembered our names, and went out of their way to help every time we approached. One of the very few hotels I have every visited that was worth every cent. The staff is first class and the facilities are as well!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: lgt565
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay downtown and the Peninsula was perfect. The room and view were fantastic. The service was impeccable. Every employee you passed genuinely greeted you. The management here clearly does a wonderful job. The only thing I would point out was that I emailed the concierge prior to my arrival for restaurant recommendations and noone ever responded back. Other than that the stay was absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, amazing bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MiaT
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Peninsula. Excellent Location. Loved the bar downstairs. The rooms are large and have every amenity you can think of. I loved the bench outside the closet for throwing suitcases. My son loved the fact that he could watch cartoons while taking a bath. They even gave him a little Peninsula bear to take home dressed as a bell hop. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “good chicago hotel at the right price”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at another competitor in Chicago. There was an unusually good special so we decided to try the Peninsula. We had a 1 BD suite. Views in this hotel are not as good as the FS where we we usually stay but we did have a nice view of Water Tower, and a little bit of the lake. Main bathroom is a little small, suite had low ceilings and the TV was outdated. Our mini-bar was not refilled during our stay once....no diet sodas after the first day. The restaurants were empty or having special events during our stay, so even though we were offered a discount we could not use it and try them. Hotel was nice enough to credit toward the stay. Concierges were very good at getting basic info, though they push the restaurant of a former chef that we thought was a poor suggestion. The bar is old school but really smells of smoke even though it is non-smoking. The pool/ spa is nice. The location is central Michigan Ave near the major dept. stores. I would return only if I found a great deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every category”
Reviews.Author: Entscheidungsproblem
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights in an Executive Suite at The Peninsula while visiting friends from my college days. This was my second stay at The Peninsula and it won't be my last. In addition to the stunning service and facilities, I was able to get a very decent rate under one of their summer specials. My room was extremely spacious (see photos)--separate living room, entrance hallway, connecting hallway, etc. One of my favorite things about the Peninsula is the amount of room devoted to dressing--plenty of closet space, drawers, and mirrors. The sound-proofing was superb--windows open you could hear sirens and all the other sounds of the city, but once they were closed there was no sound from outside. One of the most attractive things about this room was the bathtub with a window overlooking Michigan Avenue--I took baths just to be able to look through the window! The technology is, if anything, over the top--I counted six telephones or equivalents (like the voice-operated one in the bathtub) in the suite, two televisions, a stereo system, and the Peninsula-standard electronic control systems (see photo)--on one morning when I slept in light and housekeeping knocked on the door (a long way from the bedroom) I just had to roll over and hit the "Privacy" button on the phone--a light turned on outside the room and that was it. No complaints at all about this trip, but I do have two suggestions, both from The Berkeley in London-- 1) The deck chairs on the sun roof outside often appeared occupied even though no-one was there--it would be worthwhile to clean these more frequently or to put up a sign asking people to clear away their belongings when they were done so that more people could enjoy the sun deck. 2) Shoes left overnight for polishing should be returned with temporary shoe trees.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection....Didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: krittert
Reviews.Content: Hands down the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel is in a great location, the room was gorgeous and the public areas of the hotel are beautiful. The service is stellar. The hotel staff knows what you need before you even know yourself, but they do it in a way that is not "in your face" and too much. We went to the Bears game and the whole time I just wanted to get back to the hotel to enjoy the roof-top bar overlooking Michigan Ave. We finally made it back and the bar was awesome (not to be missed), and the staff treated us to complimentary champagne for my birthday. The next day I had lunch w/ a friend at the restaurant in the lobby and I mentioned to her that we were there celebrating my birthday (I don't even recall the waitress being w/in ear shot) but the next thing you know there is a birthday dessert served at the table. The waitress overheard me say we were there for my birthday. I cannot say enough about the wonderful hotel. I stayed at the Trump a couple of months later and let me tell you that it PALES in comparison to the Peninsula. Not even in the same league. If you can afford it, stay at this hotel when in Chicago. The Peninsula has won a regular client. Will be staying at the Peninsula in NYC soon, hope I am not dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A reason in itself to visit Chicago”
Reviews.Author: SuitNflipflops
Reviews.Content: Always perfect. Period. One of my favorite hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Off the charts good.”
Reviews.Author: Brewer21
Reviews.Content: This is a spectacular hotel. There isn't one thing I could complain about. The service, ammenities, location and room were all great. It is very expensive but you get what you pay for. Flat screen in the room, iPod dock, free wi-fi, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on and one of the best showers I've ever had in a room. Everything is first class. I'm not sure I'd take kids here although there were some around. The pool is nice but mostly set up for lap swimming and there is a hot tub as well. Both are indoor.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: 2broadway
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip at the last minute so naturally the rate was pretty high. I've read so many favorable comments about the Peninsula that I just had to check it out for myself. Needless to say, I was not disappointed. The service I received from the moment I stepped in front of the hotel (greeted warmly by valet) until the day I departed was memorable. I am hooked. While there I visited the pool area and felt so relaxed I fell asleep in no time. The iced lemon water and iced strawberry water was a nice touch. Breakfast in the lobby restaurant was nice as well. I also visited the bar and received great service. The servers were friendly and offered great suggestions on where to view the fireworks. Fridays & Saturdays the hotel provides live jazz in the lobby area where you can enjoy cocktails and meals. The lighting was perfect for the setting. I must say the thing that I like the most was the control box that is placed on the nightstand. You can control the TV, the lights and the alarm clock. No more looking for the remote. I must get one for my bedroom. One other thing that I found favorable was the fact that the hotel places your newspaper in a small handled bag which is hung on the door knob. No more bending down to retrieve the newspaper. The money was well spent. I can hardly wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RLA
Reviews.Content: These comments are a year delayed; we stayed in Aug, 2008. Peninsula Chicago is by far the best luxury in Chicago -- perfect location, boutique-like stellar personal service, gorgeous spa, beautiful marble bathrooms in the rooms, traditional rooms with modern amenities and superb linens. Absolutely the best in five-star luxury in Chicago. NB: We viewed our friends' room at the Four Seasons Chicago and, while perfectly adequate for a hotel in general, for five-star, it seemed a bit stale and outdated; the common areas of the Four Seasons were unimpressive for "five star" -- if you're spending this kind of money, absolutely opt for the Peninsula vs. Four Seasons => no contest.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: G8TR73
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel in Chicago considering the location and quality of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend aside from our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: henslcc
Reviews.Content: I booked a Fri and Sat Night stay at the Peninsula for my wife and my 1st wedding Anniversary. To simply put it, the Peninsula exceeded our expectations of luxury, service, and relaxation. Check-in was fine, it is a nice touch for the front desk attendant to peronally escort you to your room, give you a brief tour, and inquire of any other needs. The Deluxe king we booked was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The kingsize bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows and soft comforter. The bathroom was very large, marble everything, the highlight is the tv/radio controls for use while in the bathtub. The deep soaking tub and seperate shower have excellent water pressure and space for two. On Saturday night we went to the lobby for the Jazz at the Pen. The jazz quartet was very good, able to read and play off of the crowd. The spa and finess center were top notch. The pool is very nice and sun filled, there is an outdoor sundeck, but it can get quite windy 20 floors up. Room service, housekeeping, and the front desk staff are very efficient and accomodating. Our weekend at the Peninsula Hotel was arguably the best we have ever had, aside from our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “What a town, what a hotel, what a meal...”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller9569
Reviews.Content: Great 5 nights at The Peninsular where the service was supreme, the room great, the location perfect and the food delightful. Ate the mad 15 course tasting menu at Avenues - little bit too much food for our delicate UK stomachs though the locals seemed to fare better! Great room service food and excellent staff. Concierges were superb and really did know where to go and what was what in terms of tours, restaurants and places to visit... Spa worked a treat - great views and great massage - nothing too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: You come into the hotel and come up one floor to the main lobby to register. The rooms are large and very well decorated with mood lights even in the bath room. The shower was one of the best I've had and the hot water comes on right away, with excellent pressure. The health club is well situated in the top floor with and indoor pool. The bed was outstanding, with very comfortable down comforters. Meals are a little on the high side, but very well presented, but with small portions. Meals are served in a beautiful lobby and a delightful place to hold a business lunch. Service in the whole hotel was excellent and lived up to the reputation of the Peninsular. It is well located opposite Saks 5th Ave, and half a block from the main shopping street.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Absolutely Worldclass”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 wonderful days at the Pen Chicago. It was our anniversary so we received a double upgrade (one for Amex FH&R and one for the anniversary). We booked a junior suite so we ended up in a deluxe suite. The room was very fresh and new looking. The furniture was in excellent condition, electronics were of the highest standard (Ipod ports at TV's, memory card ports at TV's, the usual Peninsula bedside console, DVD players and a TV in the bathroom). Kudos for the free wireless! The bed was comfortable with soft sheets, the bathroom was large with a big shower plus a separate soaking tub and the sitting area was spacious. The soundproofing in our room was excellent and the blackout curtains made for a great sleeping environment. Service was top-notch. The bellmen were fast and friendly. The front desk staff accompanied us to our room and were exceedingly gracious. Housekeeping was thorough yet almost invisible. The concierge made good recommendations about dining and places to see. The hotel arranged airport transportation which was flawless. Dining: Shanghai Terrace is exceptional for high end Chinese, I cannot adequately praise this place. Be warned it is pricey but worth it. Room service is both prompt and quite good albeit very costly. Pierrot the French cafe is ok and a quick place to grab lunch or breakfast. The Bar is always crowded and if I had one complaint we had a sour waitress the one night we went down who shorted me on my scotch as I received the "last shot" in the bottle. That was not an excuse for a short drink. On our anniversary the hotel sent chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of French Champagne which was unexpected and very nice. This hotel delivered a product and service at an exceptional level for the United States. As a very frequent traveler this hotel is among the best I have seen in a US city. Yes, it is very pricey but they deliver a top notch experience with great rooms and great service. The location cannot be beat either.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet wonderful luxury”
Reviews.Author: gams1000
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is lovely without being obnoxiously so (well, ok, sending up a bellhop in an all white sailor suit with white gloves to deliver a grimy fedex package was farily silly but I'll overlook that). Had the most relaxing two day hotel stay and I'll def stay here aging if only for the assurance that a pair of fresh padded slippers, a plush robe, and the best bath towels I've ever encountered will be waiting for me. (Also really like that they have a push button system that declares your room off limits to housekeeping until you push another button that asks for them to make up the room.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but exorbitantly expensive”
Reviews.Author: heathspeak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Peninsula for three nights in August. The room was on the 15th floor, somewhat near the elevator, but wonderfully quiet and luxurious. The staff were exceedingly polite, but forgot to retrieve the room service cart, sometimes for hours. Having to take two elevators to get to my room was a bit of a hassle as well. The room service food, and the food in the Lobby, was not worth the money- don't eat in the hotel, go elsewhere. Extremely expensive- but if it's no object and you want a gorgeous, quiet and comfortable room, then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: PoLR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is completely over-rated. The staff was mediocre, the rooms had an odd odor. I've stayed at much nicer, actual 5 star hotels. This was not one of them. Maybe it works for Chicago, but I'd rather stay at the Four Seasons, Ritz, or the Park Hyatt. Really, don't believe the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: saint22
Reviews.Content: Amid comments of, why are you going to Chicago in March?, I planned a short trip and booked a room at the Peninsula. My wife and I were accompanied by our two children . Our son is aged 5 and and our daughter is aged 18 months. We had never been to the Peninsula before, but its reputation convinced me to stay there. I arranged through the hotel to have a car to meet us at the airport upon our arrival. Inside the terminal a man was waiting for us holding a Peninsula Hotel sign. He greeted us and led us outside to the waiting car. Our car was a black Lincoln stretch limousine. My son loved the car and the driver whisked us away from the airport for a relaxing ride to the hotel. We pulled up to the hotel which is guarded by two very large oriental lion statues. We were greeted by a very friendly doorman named Timothy. He took my name and said our bags would be delivered to our room shortly. We proceeded inside the hotel and took the elevator to the lobby to check in. We were greeted warmly as we completed our check in. The Lobby Restaurant room was near the elevators and it is just as stunning in person as in all pictures I had seen of it. The friendly woman who checked us in led us to the elevator and took us to our room on the twelfth floor. We had booked a junior suite #1217 because we needed the space. The room was done in shades of yellow and gold. The truly great hotels always do the little things that set them apart and the Peninsula accomplished this brilliantly. On the cocktail table in front of the sofa in the living room was a paper model of a 1956 light blue Ford Thunderbird convertible. Inside the seating compartment was a linen napkin wrapped around two chocolate chip cookies. Next to the car was a martini glass filled with gummy bears. Next to the martini glass was a small teacup and saucer and a small silver spoon. Inside the teacup was orange gelatin. There was also a beautiful purple box of Vosges Haut-Chocolat exotic truffles on the desk. The room looked out onto N. Michigan Avenue and the large window made the view exceptional. The room was spacious and inviting. The next wonderful detail that the hotel accomplished still puts a smile on my face. In the closet were robes for us to wear while we relaxed. There were two adult robes and two robes for the children. The robes for the children had hoods and were sized so as to fit them each perfectly. We got some great photographs of the kids in those robes. The room was equipped with consoles by the bed that controlled all the environmental adjustments for the room. The bathroom was gorgeous and well-equipped. There was a television that could be viewed while bathing in the bathtub. The kids loved watching TV while taking their evening baths. Turn down service was completed every evening much to our satisfaction. We had lunch at the french bistro connected to the hotel. The food and service were both excellent. After our visit to the observation deck of the Sears Tower, we returned to the hotel and had dinner at the Lobby Restaurant. This restaurant is a gorgeous palatial space. The food was wonderful as was our server Don. I enjoyed a Peninsula Martini and my wife enjoyed her Blood Orange Martini. After dinner we retired to our room and I slept deeply on the very comfortable bed. The next morning, I watched the kids while my wife indulged in a swedish massage at the Spa. She said Donald did a great job. After that we all had breakfast in the the french bistro and headed out to see some of the culture of the city. We took the kids to the Science and Industry Museum, Millenium Park and the Art Institute of Chicago. The weather was cooperative with the temperature in the mid to upper 40's and mostly sunny. The Cloud Gate was fun to see in person. Upon our return to the hotel, my son and I enjoyed the pool and the hot tub before we went to dinner. What a scenic setting to swim laps. I loved it. I wanted to try Chicago style pizza on our last night so I phoned the Concierge and she recommended either Gino's East or Giordano's. Since we had the kids, we chose Giordano's because it was right across the street on North Rush Street. We ordered the stuffed pizza and it was incredibly good. I was raised on the thin crust pizza of New Haven, Connecticut but I got to tell you, the stuffed pizza here, while different ,was every bit as enjoyable as any pizza I have ever had. After dinner we retired to our room, bathed the kids and fell asleep. The next morning we had an early breakfast in the Lobby Restaurant. Again, the food and service were excellent. We returned to our room and collected our luggage and proceeded to check out. I used the express checkout method and we took the elevator to the ground level. Timothy the doorman saw us off and our limousine returned us to O'Hare for our trip home. What a fabulous stay at the Chicago Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable”
Reviews.Author: trillo
Reviews.Content: everything was great, food, room, service, concierge. i would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea.”
Reviews.Author: courtney7888
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the Chicago for a few days after Christmas, and for the most part we enjoyed our stay at the Peninsula. Upon entering the hotel, you take an elevator to get to the lobby and then another elevator to get to your room. The elevators were quick, but give yourself a few extra minutes to get downstairs if ever in a hurry while staying there. Our room was on the 11th floor and had excellent views. My family of four shared two bedrooms which were separated by a parlor that had a desk, couches, TV, and a half bathroom. The bedrooms were average in size and dÃ©cor and generally underwhelming. The bathrooms however, were fabulous. There was a television above the bathtub, and ample space to get ready. The hotel supplied Molton Brown products as well as toothbrushes, razors, sewing and nail kits, etc. Beds were comfy, and free bottles of water piled up after turndown. My major qualm with our room was the technology. I was under the impression that everything would be very high tech and sleek and it just wasnâ€™t. The bulky control centers were confusing and outdated. And the plasma TV and DVD players I thought I was getting were clunky and old. I think its time for an upgrade. The service was mediocre at best. While everybody was polite, I felt as if the Peninsulaâ€™s employees were only greeting me because it was their job to do so, not because they cared about me. Several times I had to be the person who initiated the â€œhelloâ€� or â€œgood morning.â€� I donâ€™t expect to be waited on hand and foot, but the occasional feeling that the concierge or front desk or dining room servers were happy to see me would have been nice. In terms of hotel food, the room service was average. My family ordered some snacks one day and nothing was exceptional. Breakfast at Avenues was delicious, but nothing I couldnâ€™t get at any other fine hotel. I do not recommend tea. The tea was ok, but the food was horrible. I donâ€™t think I enjoyed a single thing, and there was plenty to choose from. The thing that I liked best about the hotel was its location. All of Chicagoâ€™s highlights, including the shops on Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier, are just a walk away. Thereâ€™s plenty to do, see, buy and eat, and no need for a taxi or rental car to get there. I absolutely love Chicago, and its hard to fault the Peninsula for making my time less fun filled, because it most certainly was. However, next time, Iâ€™ll opt to stay at the Drake or the W Lakeshore, where I can get a little more bang for my buckâ€”and a little personality.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: joelfranceusa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, pure luxury, excellent service, we will go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great food”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsula Chicago for two nights in October 2008 while on business. Had a room on the 15th Floor with views of the Water Works. Everything about this property was wonderful. The lobby and conference areas were beautiful and put together really well to host a large event with multiple meetings. The quality and selection of food made attending meetings a real treat, and room service, salads and burgers at least, were great. Now for the room: it was huge! The bathroom had its own couch! Excellent desk and business set-up with extremely comfortable bed. I don't even think I used every piece of furniture in the room it was so big! Can't beat the location either - you're literally steps away from Michigan Avenue shopping and world famous pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Close but no cigar at the Peninsula Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cubswincubswin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while in town visiting family and friends. I've stayed at 5 of the 8 Peninsula locations and although this is certainly one of the more luxurious properties they have, the service lags behind the other locations. Now by no means is the service "bad;" just not up to par with it's sister hotels. At the other Peninsula locations, I would consider the service (relative to other hotels, not just the Peninsula Chicago) above and beyond; over-the-top; and sublime. At the Peninsula Chicago, I would consider the service as above average. For instance, at other Peninsula locations, they welcome you with a welcome drink in the room and possibly a light snack. No such greeting at the Chicago Peninsula. At other Peninsula locations, when the Spa was booked, the receptionist offered to either call me if there were any cancellations and even recommended some local Spas - not at the Peninsula Chicago. The rooms are great, the location couldn't be better and the restaurants are top-notch. My friends that live in the neighborhood all love The Bar at the Peninsula as well as the Chocolate Bar they have every Friday and Saturday. It's a wonderful hotel... the service just isn't over-the-top as I've come to expect having stayed at most of their other properties. The hotel accommodations are important but not as much as customer service. At the 5-star level one expects a high level of customer service. The Peninsula Chicago's customer service is attentive at best, mildly impersonal at worst. The Park Hyatt next door isn't quite as luxurious (a little too contemporary for my taste) however their service was surprisingly helpful. If location and a high level of customer service is all you desire, you may want to look into the Park Hyatt Chicago; for shorter trips, I know I will.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jj1972Texas
Reviews.Content: Fabulous. We stayed with our two toddlers at the last minute for one night due to an airline mishap. Our son has severe food allergies and they were very accommodating of his needs. The service was excellent, the food was excellent, the rooms are delightful, and the bed is exceedingly comfortable. Expensive, but definitely an example of 'you get what you pay for.'

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Aflores02
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at this hotel. From the concierge service to the Laundry service to management, everybody is just so kind and wonderful. Everything was perfectly timely and arranged in detailed to please the customers. The Hotel has an excelent Buffet that serves breakfast and lunch. What a variety of delicious food! Love it! We had a problem with our Limo service which had a miss-schedule out pick up time and the hotel manager called the company and had limo picked us up in 25 minutes. Just in time so we did not missed the fly back home. We would move to live at the Peninsula if we could afford it all year round!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Style”
Reviews.Author: tvl20
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a corporate rate for business. I was impressed with everything the hotel had to offer, especially the pool. The crowd was a little old for my tast - looked like a lot of bankers. I did enjoy watching the working girls pick up on them in the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius_7
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in what I hoped was the best hotel in town and so my expectations were high.The Peninsula did not disappoint.My room was a kingsize deluxe and although it overlooked another building on a side street it was very quiet (unless you open the windows) and well appointed. The staff were all very helpful, efficient and courteous. The spa is very well designed with a nice indoor pool. The outdoor sundeck enabled some sunbathing and room service could be ordered there.The massages in the spa were good but the standard varied.I had three different therapists and one was considerably better than the other two.For 155 dollars for sixty minutes I would have liked more consistency. The location of the hotel is excellent...right by Michigan Avenue. I would recommend Peirrot Gourmet for breakfast which is quite casual. It is part of the hotel so you can charge to your bill but is accessed from the street by the hotel so is very close by but gives the feeling of being out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great & Pricey Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: beverlyblvd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in June, and had a great time. The accommodations are first class, the location is stellar, and the staff is top-notch. You get exactly what you pay for. Our room was very large, the beds were very comfy, and the location is right off of Michigan Ave., so everything we did was walking distance away. We even caught the train to Wrigley & the airport, so I think we only took one cab -- which was to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a little dated, and problems with the electrical systems”
Reviews.Author: Court_SF
Reviews.Content: I have heard great things about this hotel, so I was a little disappointed with conditions on my stay. We were in Room 1523, an executive suite. Here are the pros: Location is excellent--you can't beat it. Right off of Mag Mile. Service is excellent. Friendly staff, we got an upgrade when we checked in. Courteous prompt attention the whole time. When we checked in, we had a little fruit/nut plate waiting for us, and they brought us welcome green tea within 1/2 hour of check-in. That was a nice touch. Suite size was great. Laid out well, lots of room, and it had my favorite thing--a bathtub with a giant window above it. They gave us a late check out of 3pm, which was awesome. Here are the cons: The decor is a little dated and worn. The carpet in our room had what at first looked like a huge water stain running down the hall, upon closer inspection was a tread path from overuse. The very complicated lighting system did not work. There are panels all over the room to control lights and other systems, and they malfunctioned the whole time. Which meant that when we tried to go to sleep that night, we could NOT TURN THE LIGHTS OFF. We had to call maintenance. To their credit, they sent someone up right away to reset. However, the problem continued throughout the night with the lights going on and off as we were sleeping. Yeah, REALLY annoying. Luckily I had a couple cocktails (hey, it was Bluesfest), so I was able to go back to sleep each time. We told the staff when we were checking out about the problem. They were nice enough, and told us that they were in the middle of a "green update" (right, right) that was causing the problems. I just feel like for $700 a night, the lights should work in the room, no?

Reviews.Title: “A++ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: droses
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula is everything a 5 star hotel should be. The staff is professional, poised and very helpful. The rooms are well appointed, the counsel next to the bed is unique and fabulous. We finally found a hotel bed that's MORE comfortable than ours at home (not an easy task). The spa is beautiful. Although we didn't have treatments, we enjoyed the facilies (workout room, steam room, pool, hot tub, outdoor patio). The spa had very thoughtful touches throughout - e.g. swim diapers for kids, various flavored water and tea, plush towels - all terrific. Avenues (one of the three restaurants). Oh my. Fantastic food, unbelievably creative, delicious. The service was terrific. HOWEVER, the portions are pathetic. For $375 (for two), we should not leave hungry. The waitress explains that each course is 2-3 bites. So, the four course is 12 bites for $75. And, she was right. The 8 course is $115. One should not have to select the 15 course to fill their stomach. I understand that the new chef cut the portions which is a terrible mistake. I would go back in a heartbeat if the portions doubled. We have been to several other top Chicago restaurants (Tru, Trotters, Les Nomades, Everest, Moto), and we have never experienced anything like these miniscule portions. Overall, our experience at the Peninsula was wonderful and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What 5 Star Should Be”
Reviews.Author: naaman60
Reviews.Content: Everything aspect of our stay from start to finish was excellent. The hotel is immaculate, rooms are a nice size, well appointed and quiet. Staff are really helpful and the concierges I worked with were *real* concierges: they were happy to answer questions, make bookings and their advice on Chicago was very good. Front desk staff was helpful, honest and friendly. Gym is beautifully equipped with plenty of machines and an excellent class/stretching room, all with big windows. Pool is a full 25 meters with windows right down to the floor, a great place for a swim! Apples and coffee to go at the gym and pool were a very nice touch in the morning. I travel over 50% of the time and a hotel like this stands out for the comprehensive high quality of all services and facilities offered. I'll certainly stay here again when I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Standard”
Reviews.Author: mannym99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the standard by which ALL hotels should be judged, not just Chicago, but anywhere. It is first-class in every way, from the doormen, to the bellhop, to the front desk staff, to the housekeeping. The location is perfect for downtown shopping and sightseeing. The rooms are gorgeous. The food was outstanding. I did not visit the spa but heard only great things. Obviously it is expensive, but this is the pinnacle of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Romance at the Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: Tashatart
Reviews.Content: Flawless! Nothing more can be said. Service was excellent, the food was awesome and the location is amazing! Situated atop Tiffany's on Michigan (does it get any better?!) its in the middle of everything. The staff is very helpful. Of course it all comes at a pretty penny, but the suite is worth it - with a plasma in the bathtub, press button EVERYTHING, floor to ceiling windows, its exquisite.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: screen_nameMidwest
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on a business trip. The room was fine; the bathroom exceptional. I love the way a light comes on in the closet when you open the closet door. The staff was friendly and repeatedly offered to help. I have two relatively minor quibbles: I had to search the room for a water glass to brush my teeth. I finally found one in the bedroom with the water bottle. A slip up by the staff? Secondly, I like to have a cup of coffee in the morning without ordering it through room service. There was no coffee maker in the room. (I noted when checking out, though, that coffee urns and paper cups were in the lobby. )

Reviews.Title: “I'd Give It Six Stars If I Could”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel stays of my life, from start to finish--maybe THE best urban hotel experience. Every need was anticipated and there was a thoughtful touch at every turn. I spent Easter weekend in Chicago and stayed at both the Four Seasons and the Peninsula, and though the 4S was nice and thoroughly professional, it paled next to the Peninsula. My stay here was starting off well anyway, since I had gotten a special holiday rate of $295/night. That's practically unheard-of for this hotel. Despite the low rate, I was still upgraded to a premium-view room on check-in, with a direct view of the water tower and the Hancock Tower. The rooms are wonderfully plush, with closet and drawer space set in a vestibule outside the bathroom so that there's room for a full sofa even in the standard rooms. Bedding is tops, and though the color scheme is still primarily beige, there are nice colorful touches in the textiles. Of course you've probably read about all the high tech gizmos and how practically everything is controlled by a button [Except, oddly enough, the curtains, which are still pullcord-operated. That and the fact that the hotel really needs to upgrade to flat-screen TVs would be my only small quibbles.] The bathrooms are glorious, with deep soaking tubs, easy-to-operate fixtures with great temperature control, and the TV/radio operated from a tubside control. I was checked in by a professional, warm staffer who handed me confirmed restaurant reservations--even though I had booked them through OpenTable; there must be some sort of name cross-checking. I then got a personal tour of the room including its electronics. The Lobby is a huge, beautiful space with tall columns and an airy feel. It's Art Deco with Asian touches. Lunch service there was flawless; the menu is fairly standard for this sort of place, though they do have purple sweet-potato fries. I also went back for the weekend evening chocolate fantasy. At $33, it's a bit of indulgence since you can really only eat so much chocolate late at night without making yourself sick. However, it's a nifty signature offering and just the selection of offerings is fun; plus, they were all tasty.
